job_description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

Role: The Business Development Representative (BDR) responsible for driving sales of Moody’s Analytics products to new customers for their initial use.. Key activities include initiating sales activity with new-to-company prospects through lead research and qualification. Using a consultative sales approach, you will identify and develop a good understanding of the clients’ business needs and deliver an value proposition of Moody’s Analytics that satisfy those needs.  You will be responsible for managing the complete sales cycle from start to finish and based on the complexity of the opportunity, you may engage sales specialists to facilitate the sales process.  

 

Responsibilities:

  • Manage a wide sales territory of new-to-Moody’s prospects.  Build and execute on territory-based campaigns to meet or exceed annual sales goals.
  • Establish Moody’s Analytics presence with new-to-company prospects with the goal to land our initial solution at these accounts.
  • Execute against territory-based campaign plans to generate sales from new customers.
  • Work with sales colleagues to drive the sales process from beginning to end by identifying and qualifying prospects, initiating new sales activity, and managing sales cycles to closure. Typical contacts include single-use buying influencers.
  • Assess the needs of the client by gaining an understanding of the challenges they face based on their business objectives and position relevant Moody’s Analytics use cases
  • Coordinate Moody's Analytics responses to requests for product and services information from prospects and clients.
  • Represent company at industry and company sponsored events, as required.
  • Provide current forecasts and pipeline information to management.
  • Position requires travel (approximately 20% to 40% of your time). 

Qualifications:

 

  • Undergraduate/first-level degree (e.g., Bachelor’s degree) required, with coursework in business, economics, finance, marketing or related fields.
  • 8+ years’ experience working in direct business-to-business sales roles with a focus on solutions selling
  • Ability to lead standard sales cycles to successful conclusion.
  • Experience with sales enablement tools (Salesforce, ZoomInfo, LinkedIn, SalesLoft, etc.) to create professional, tailored prospecting strategies
  • Ability to present high-level information as well as detailed demonstrations of products & services.
  • Fundamental understanding of industry dynamics and how clients interact with the products/services
  • Willingness to create high-volume and quality client interactions/connects by making daily sales calls, networking, building relationships and identifying sales opportunities
  • Ability to design and articulate a proposition for the customer and win/close business
  • Ability to work both independently and within a team environment, with focus and high attention to detail.

For US-based roles only: the anticipated hiring base salary range for this position is  [[$117,000]] to [[$152,000]] , depending on factors such as experience, education, level, skills, and location. This range is based on a full-time position. In addition to base salary, this role may be eligible for a completion bonus. Moody’s also offers insurance and a discounted employee stock purchase plan for limited duration employees.

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, gender, age, religion, national origin, citizen status, marital status, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Moody’s also provides reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities or based on a sincerely held religious belief in accordance with applicable laws. If you need to inquire about a reasonable accommodation, or need assistance with completing the application process, please email accommodations@moodys.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only, and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

For San Francisco positions, qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

This position may be considered a promotional opportunity, pursuant to the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act.

Role / Responsibilities:

Methodology Delivery Team

We are looking for a highly-motivated individual to join as Assistant Vice President-Delivery Manager in the Methodology Delivery Team. The Team is responsible for methodology project delivery using agile principles according to plan and scope.

The successful candidate will have the following responsibilities:

  • Creating and leading positive, collaborative, and supported working group environments
  • Driving scrum meetings and delivering successful results on a timely and consistent basis
  • Facilitating working group discussion, decision making, and conflict resolution
  • Proactively assessing and managing project risks and mitigation plans
  • Driving communication, improving transparency, and radiating information amongst stakeholders
  • Continuous coaching and training working groups in agile and lean principles
  • Tracking and reporting progress and dependencies, proactively identifying roadblocks and removing impediments
  • Supporting management with periodic and ad-hoc reporting
  • Managing working group commitments and deliverables

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree required preferably in business or technology.
  • Eight to ten years of experience in managing complex, global and fast-paced cross functional projects following agile principles.
  • Strong communications skills (oral and written) including experience in moderating working group sessions for consensus building.
  • Excellent judgement and problem-solving skills, ability to negotiate interpersonal, inter-team conflict sessions.
  • Exceptional organizational skills and ability to be agile and handle multiple projects and timelines while being detail oriented.
  • Strong team player with the ability to work independently - proactive, flexible, diligent, with the highest ethical standards.
  • High level of personal initiative and is a self-starter.
  • Proficiency in Agile Project Management tools (Jira, Confluence).
  • Advanced knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Teams.
  • Scrum master certification is a plus, but not essential.

This job involves managing IT assets across North America. The role requires frequent communication with HR, legal teams, and third-party vendors, and involves responsibilities such as inventory and ticket management, problem-solving, policy implementation, hardware management, and support for accounts payable.

Responsibilities:

  • Communication: Manage email and MS Teams messages promptly.
  • Inventory Management: Maintain hardware inventory and investigate any variances.
  • Ticket Management: Update tickets in ServiceNow with relevant details. Document and report any process failures to the VP.
  • Problem-Solving: Identify issues, develop proactive solutions, and ensure compliance with IT operational performance metrics and SLAs.
  • Policy Implementation: Implement and maintain policies, procedures, and performance standards. Document these procedures and any updates.
  • Receiving Hardware: Manage the receipt of new and used hardware, including updating ITAM and coordinating with facilities team. Requires after hours support for larger deliveries.
  • Hardware Disposal and Repurposing: Coordinate the disposal or repurposing of hardware, including wiping hard drives and coordinating with third-party vendors.
  • Stockroom Management: Maintain stockroom organization and inventory levels, and manage offsite storage.
  • Equipment Requests: Fulfill equipment shipping requests to regional offices.
  • Hardware Servicing: Coordinate warranty repairs with OEMs.
  • Legal Holds: Manage the legal hold ticket queue and the storage of devices on legal hold.
  • Accounts Payable Support: Update the GRN Excel file with the status of items received against PO.
  • Ad-hoc Projects: Participate in donations and GRE-related projects.

Key Competencies:

  • Ability to work independently
  • Team player with a positive attitude
  • Strong communication skills and professionalism
  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage priorities
  • Willingness to go beyond normal job requirements

Required Qualifications:

  • Intermediate Excel proficiency
  • English language proficiency
  • Understanding of IT Asset Management lifecycle and best practices
  • Experience with ServiceNow
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Windows and M365.

About the Team

The financial modeling team, part of Model Development group building world’s best catastrophe models, focus on providing end-to-end solutions to analyzing the financial impact of RMS’s catastrophe models. Our responsibility includes building analytical and simulation models for financial contracts and metrics for portfolio analysis, developing algorithms, writing specs, building prototypes on distributed environment and implementing production software on AWS based SaaS platform. Our scope also includes supply chain modelling and simulation, machine learning applications in exposure data analysis, such as image analysis and large dataset mining using deep learning and classical machine learning tools. We also perform applied research in these areas.     

 

Senior Software Engineer

We are looking for a Senior Scientific Programmer to join a growing team of developers and modelers. We are seeking someone who is excited about tackling complex software challenges and solving difficult business problems.

As a senior programmer, you are expected to be proficient writing production quality code in an object-oriented language. You must be able to dive into any existing code.  You must be a strong team player, contributing ideas and taking constructive critical feedback. You should be able to work independently, juggling multiple items concurrently while contributing to multiple areas within a large project.

Required Skills and Experience:

  • 3+ years of programming experience; proven track record of on-time delivery
  • Experience writing production-level code in C#, Java, or C++.
  • Demonstrable knowledge of data structures and algorithms.
  • Familiarity with probability and statistics.
  • Master’s degree in STEM field.

Preferred Skills and Experience:

  • Experience in linear programming applications.
  • 5+ years of programming experience
  • Experience in performance tuning and bottleneck analysis
  • Python experience
  • Machine learning experience.

Role/Responsibilities:

The Digital Insights OU is hiring for an initiative to increase recognition of Moody’s value proposition among a wide range of financial market participants by providing highest level of financials data governance and ensure data quality and usability of our products.

The Data Operations Specialist will work within an initiative focused in analyzing published financial documents of corporate entities around the globe. The role will leverage competency in accounting, capital markets, and financial statement analysis to extract relevant data and insights from published documents. The ideal candidate will possess a goal-oriented mindset, an interest in growing their competency and career, and a desire to collaborate with a global team, particularly partnering with the Data Operations Lead/SME and the Data Operations Manager.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyzing and extracting data, insights, and other information from financial documents
  • Reviewing financial documents which include Income Statement, Balance Sheet and Cash Flow Statement from the annual/interim and regulatory statements of entities across the world
  • Knowledge of US GAAP, local GAAP, and/or IFRS, is required (knowledge of several and others is a bonus)
  • Conducting detailed quality checks of own work, as well as others is required
  • Adhering to timeliness deadlines with quality output is a primary characteristic of the work
  • Ability to work independently and in a global team
Qualifications :

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field required

Languages:

  • English: Advanced written and verbal command
  • Spanish: Advanced written and verbal command
  • Business proficiency in other languages a plus

Skills and Experience

  • 1-3 years of experience of analyzing financial statements
  • Advanced understanding of various company filings (10K, annual reports, Solvency reports) and should be comfortable with secondary research
  • Hands on experience extracting pertinent insights from financial statements
  • Knowledge of accounting/financial documents
  • Superior attention to detail, analytical ability and problem-solving skills
  • Organized, dependable, able to multi-task and manage priorities, display initiative, and the ability to work independently
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office products and particularly Excel, such as pivot tables, lookups, etc.

summary_job_summary: The Moody’s Community Impact Team is dedicated to making a positive difference in our communities and the lives of our employees around the globe through alignment of philanthropy and employee engagement with Moody’s vision and business opportunities. Our commitment is built on our employees’ deeply ingrained sense of social responsibility and the recognition that our company grows stronger by helping to advance the lives of others through responsible business practices and corporate citizenship. Through our active participation in our communities, we better understand needs and opportunities for improvement, and strive to address those needs and opportunities that are most consistent with the values of our corporation and employees. The Community Impact team coordinates Community Impact activities, and through the Moody’s Foundation, manages relationships with non-profit organization. Every Moody’s employee has the opportunity to serve the community through volunteerism, employee-directed giving, and/or board service. The Moody’s Foundation is funded by an annual distribution from Moody’s Corporation.

The Department / Team:

The Moody’s Community Impact Team is dedicated to making a positive difference in our communities and the lives of our employees around the globe through alignment of philanthropy and employee engagement with Moody’s vision and business opportunities. Our commitment is built on our employees’ deeply ingrained sense of social responsibility and the recognition that our company grows stronger by helping to advance the lives of others through responsible business practices and corporate citizenship. Through our active participation in our communities, we better understand needs and opportunities for improvement, and strive to address those needs and opportunities that are most consistent with the values of our corporation and employees. The Community Impact team coordinates Community Impact activities, and through the Moody’s Foundation, manages relationships with non-profit organization. Every Moody’s employee has the opportunity to serve the community through volunteerism, employee-directed giving, and/or board service. The Moody’s Foundation is funded by an annual distribution from Moody’s Corporation. 

Role Overview:

  • The candidate will be engaged in a fast-paced, collaborative environment – working side by side with experience Community Impact professionals to support the implementation of global charitable giving and employee volunteer program
  • This person will develop knowledge and skills that will enhance their educational experience and set them up for success upon completion of their degree program
  • Benchmarking corporate philanthropy landscape, best practices, and trends
  • Supporting Community Impact communications for internal and external audiences
  • Additional responsibilities include:
    • Assist Foundation team with current projects
    • Research current social media trends and suggest videos, posts, or concepts
    • Develop social media strategy for employee network – Community Activities Board
    • Design internal employee benefits SharePoint
    • Design marketing brochure for both internal and external use outlining our matching gifts, matching volunteer, and community grants programs
    • Support programs and activities supporting community outreach efforts

Qualifications:

  • Undergraduate rising junior (2026 graduate)
  • We are looking for a candidate that has good communication skills, good analytical skills, and a strong ability to collaborate with different groups 
  • Experience with Microsoft Applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

job_description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

 The Role

The Senior ESG Associate (“The Associate”) will work with analysts in the ESG team in supporting the systematic and transparent integration of ESG considerations into credit analysis. The Associate will support the ongoing monitoring of ESG Issuer Profile and Credit Impact scores for systematically integrating ESG considerations into credit analysis, and to transparently communicate our opinions through narratives and credit opinions. This may include participation in relevant rating committees and discussion forums.

The Associate will also support the systematic collection of issuer-level ESG metrics and data to support MIS’ credit analysis, including from Moody’s Analytics. The Associate may also support the production of ESG-related Non-credit rating assessments (NCRAs) such as carbon transition indicators and net zero assessments. Other responsibilities my include, as needed, supporting various projects of the ESG team, including the publication of thematic research, development of ESG training modules, and representing MIS in the external market on ESG matters.

The Associate role is integral to Moody’s focus on the integration of ESG considerations into credit analysis. This role, like that of the ESG team broadly, will typically span across multiple rating groups.

 

Key Responsibilities

Portfolio Management & Credit Quality

  • Working with ESG analysts to support ESG integration into credit analysis.  Examples of analytical work may include:

  • Support ESG analysts’ research contributing to the monitoring and maintenance of ESG scores

  • Prepare periodic analysis of ESG score changes and trends

  • Contribute to the development of databases and data analysis systems and outputs using third-party data and research, public company filings and other public information as key inputs, including managing the data collection, data entry process

  • Developing familiarity with the ESG classification, heat maps, cross-sector methodology and scoring distribution across sectors and geographies

  • Developing a working knowledge of Moody’s methodologies and credit rating best practices.

  • Monitoring ESG trends by following market developments and relevant news events, analyzing issuer reporting, and supporting ESG team engagement with issuers as necessary.

  • Attending, where appropriate, rating committee meetings, including to offer analysis and opinion

Credit Administration

  • Support the ongoing development of an ESG data platform, including third-party sources and from Moody’s Analytics.

  • Collaborate with ESG support teams at affiliates ICRA and MSC to ensure seamless support to the ESG team’s efforts in data gathering and research support

  • Supporting the operation and maintenance of the ESG scoring platform.

  • Demonstrating sound understanding and judgment in applying Moody’s processes, documentation standards, and best practices, and adhering to all laws and policies.

  • Supporting the ESG team’s work with Moody’s University in maintaining and updating, as needed, a comprehensive ESG training and certification program

  • Providing feedback to the manager on the quality and accuracy of work produced by the ICRA and MSC teams, while providing constructive and proactive feedback.

Research, Investor Outreach & Market Interaction

  • Support ESG analysts in publishing thematic and issuer-specific research on ESG risks relevant to credit analysis. 

  • Collaborate with other internal teams including the broader Moody’s family outside the ratings agency and Information Technology team members as required.

  • Attending investor briefings and conferences as required; helping prepare presentation materials in some cases; arriving prepared to engage in discussions.

  • Building positive relationships with investors displaying initiative to understand the investors’ approach to ESG and proactively responding to inquiries.

Risk Identification and Escalation

  • Support compliance with applicable laws, regulations, policies, and procedures to certify relevant key codes as required.  Complete mandatory required training in a timely manner. 

  • Awareness of Moody’s risk management approach.

 

Experience / Qualifications

  • Minimum undergraduate/first-level degree (e.g. Bachelor’s Degree, or equivalent qualifications) with strong academic performance (in the US, minimum GPA of 3.0). Masters/MBA preferred.

  • An understanding of current trends in ESG and sustainable investing is an advantage.

  • Some relevant experience (including internships) in ESG integration into fixed income or equity analysis is preferred

  • Background in process oriented/data heavy tasks preferred

  • Excellent verbal, written communication, and interpersonal skills.

  • Proficient in MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Advanced Excel skills would be an advantage

  • Proactive and able to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.

  • Strong organization skills, analytical thinking, and attention to detail.

  • Ability to adapt to a changing environment and prioritize tasks accordingly.

This role offers an incredible opportunity to learn and grow rapidly in a dynamic, tech-driven environment.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity


The Data Solutions division is the commercial data business of Moody’s Analytics, bringing together a vast catalogue of data to help business decision-makers assess risks and opportunities. We are best known for Orbis, the world’s most comprehensive database of public and private companies. We are also the definitive source of ratings-related data for companies and securities that have been rated by Moody’s Investors Service. We strive to deliver convenience and insight to our customers by eliminating the hassle of sourcing, preparing and accessing data, adding value when decisions need to be made. Any analytical activity depends on reliable and accessible data, and we are proud to be a mission-critical information resource for decision-makers around the world. 
Are you a forward-thinking and agile learner keen on being part of a dynamic shift from batch processing to real-time stream processing? 
Join our vibrant team as a Junior Java Software Engineer, where you'll be at the forefront of ingesting diverse data domains into cutting-edge NoSQL datastores and Elasticsearch using Apache Kafka and Apache Flink. This role offers an incredible opportunity to learn and grow rapidly in a dynamic, tech-driven environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Dive into the world of stream processing by actively contributing to the design and development of real-time data ingestion pipelines using Java, Apache Kafka, and Apache Flink.
  • Collaborate closely with diverse teams to comprehend evolving data requirements and pioneer scalable solutions in the realm of stream processing.
  • Optimize and fine-tune our transition from batch to stream processing, focusing on performance, scalability, and reliability enhancements.
  • Actively engage in troubleshooting, ensuring seamless error handling for uninterrupted stream processing operations.
  • Contribute to comprehensive testing and validation of real-time data pipelines, ensuring high data integrity.

Requirements:

  • A Bachelor's/Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • Proficiency in Java programming or a strong willingness to rapidly develop Java skills.
  • An eagerness to explore and work with cutting-edge technologies like Apache Kafka, Apache Flink, NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB), and Elasticsearch.
  • Strong knowledge of software development principles, design patterns, and best practices.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, adaptability, and a hunger for learning in a fast-paced environment.
  • Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies and version control systems (e.g., Git).
  • Exceptional communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
  • Enthusiasm for tackling large-scale data challenges and a desire to grow within the field.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity or interest in cloud platforms and services (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • Basic understanding or exposure to containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).

This role is responsible for working with sales colleagues and other internal stakeholders to manage and grow MA’s business across a territory of existing customers.  Key activities include securing renewal rates as per yearly sales defined targets for MA’s existing business, exploring opportunities to expand it and managing sales cycles to closure.  Additionally, the role requires the assessment of client needs and providing clients with specific guidance and product overviews.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Meet or exceed annual sales goals and targets.
  • Manage a portfolio of client renewals end-to-end – including driving growth through price increases or expanded scope of services, negotiating all commercial aspects of the renewals, notifying clients of upcoming contract expiration, presenting renewal proposals, and executing appropriate agreements.
  • Identify additional products and services that client may benefit generating upselling and cross-selling opportunities. Collaborate with Domain Sales, Business Development Representatives, Industry Practice Leads and Solution Specialists for lead generation of additional use cases.
  • Identify and help mitigate roadblocks at an early stage.
  • Ensure successful, on-time execution of renewal processes and contract execution.
  • Partner with colleagues in Sales, Sales Operations, and Product Management to provide seamless support during the renewal journey.
  • Identify and manage client stakeholders and build and maintain relationships with key individuals across multiple levels (primary contact, procurement, accounts payable, legal, etc.)
  • Review and understand contract terms and conditions, ensure contracts are compliant.
  • Work closely with Customer Service, Customer Success, Product Specialists and other stakeholders to assess overall account health and review client product adoption.
  • Collaborate with Product Management and Product Strategy to promote improvement in product quality and the development of new sources of revenue.
  • Support the growth and further development and automation of renewal processes for the business. 

 

Qualifications:

  • 2-3 years professional experience in sales, sales operations and/or customer success roles.-
  • Undergraduate/first-level degree (e.g., Bachelor’s degree) required, preferably with coursework in business, economics, finance, marketing or related fields.
  • Understanding of different parts of the global financial services industry, including market dynamics and customers’ business drivers.
  • Ability to present high-level information as well as detailed demonstrations of products & services.
  • Excellent verbal/written communication and presentation skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written skills in English. Any additional language is beneficial.
  • Ability to work both independently and within a team environment, with focus and high attention to detail.

#LI-ER1

The Role / Responsibilities:

This role is responsible for addressing data-related requests and issues in our range of local products. This means assisting our first line support with client inquiries and ensuring daily communication with our information providers, as well as reporting any recurring issues to our product strategists.
Additionally, you will assist in the creation of a knowledge base gathering key data points from various providers in order to help first line support treat cases more efficiently.
The training approach we employ is a learning-by-doing strategy, meaning that you will be exposed to practical tasks from day one, while being assisted and mentored by senior team members. 
Functional responsibilities include: 
•    Respond to client requests and inquiries; you’ll perform second line support tasks (as specialist), meaning you’ll assist the first line of support (generalists) to solve data-related issues, as well as help with simple software functionality requests.

•    Build your knowledge on all the intricate details and interactions of the different elements and procedures within our database.
•    Ensure the highest data quality.

•    Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s degree preferred, ideally in Economics, Econometrics, Business Administration, or any Data / Information Technology-related field.

About the Role - Senior Technical Program Manager – Security:

This role will be responsible for managing multiple programs and ensuring a highly organized and transparent approach is taken to managing all projects. More specifically, the TPM will work with staff at all levels to build Compliant-by-Design systems by building security into all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC). To be successful in this role, you must be able to problem solve, handle change management without stress and pivot quickly. We are actively seeking someone that can show up every day with a positive attitude, give attention to detail, work well with organizational ambiguity and change, and drive cross-functional alignment.

Role Responsibilities:

  • Partner with the Security Architect to develop and maintain Secure Authorization Packages ensuring systems are continuously compliant.
  • Act as the audit liaison for engineering teams translating auditor requests into developer work items using a “Do Once, Use Many” approach.
  • Manage programs for both large & small initiatives; with consideration of risk/mitigation and the implementation of operational efficiencies throughout the project lifecycle.
  • Ability to adapt to Projects/program of broad scope, interdependent, high risk, high impact within the strategy & operational spaces.
  • Contribute to regular program reviews with executive and senior stakeholders on roadmaps and transparency on progress and identifying blocking issues.
  • Leverage project management tools and techniques to track projects and engineering deliverables.
  • Proactively advocate for and coach others in security concepts and principles.
  • Collaborate with other TPMs to ensure cohesive and prioritized progress against organizational strategy and goals.

Minimum Qualifications: 

  • Bachelor's in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or Project Management
  • 10+ years of combined experience in software engineering, cybersecurity, or project management in the software industry
  • Familiarity with fundamental security concepts required for delivering software in regulated environments such as NIST Cybersecurity Framework, SOC 2, ISO 27001
  • Experience owning program strategy, end to end delivery, and communicating results to senior leadership
  • Demonstrated experience working with cross-functional teams to design and launch initiatives
  • Excellent written, presentation, and verbal communication skills

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Industry certification(s) in Cybersecurity or Project Management
  • Experienced end-to-end SDLCs delivering SaaS solutions in regulated environments.
  • Practical application of program management methodology including agile at scale
  • Ability to build and maintain open and collaborative relationships with various levels of leadership
  • Demonstrated ability working in an ambiguous environment with ability to think strategically and execute methodically
  • Experience handling changing priorities and using good judgment when working in stressful situations
  • Proven ability to influence internal/external stakeholders without authority to adopt new processes/initiatives
  • High attention to detail including proven ability to manage multiple competing projects and priorities simultaneously
  • Demonstrated experience and proficiency in effective communication of goals and strategies across multiple leadership levels of an organization
  • Experience with Jira, Confluence, Visio, and other Microsoft Office applications

As a Senior Program Manager on this team, you will be responsible for defining and driving the process, execution, and tools for incident management across products & services for the Moody’s Analytics Platform. The need to balance individual teams’ requirements that align to consistent operating behaviors across the software organization provides the opportunity to work with complexity and to deliver significant impact. 

Strong candidates have demonstrated the ability to dive into a complex problem space, identify and articulate user and business needs, and build efficient processes and solutions. You excel at building and fostering relationships with engineers and leadership alike. Experience with SaaS Incident Management and Business Intelligence will be a key component of success. 

 

Key Job Responsibilities:

  • Partner with multiple teams and disciplines to advance incident management maturity
  • Increase efficiency in incident management structure and processes
  • Help provide policies and procedures to operationalize incident management across the software organizations
  • Drive efforts to integrate incident inputs into a central incident management system
  • Foster a culture of learning through retrospectives
  • Provide visibility into key operational metrics
  • Help teams analyze incident trends to uncover underlying problems to turn incidents into insights
  • Conduct regular service reviews and drive prioritization of service improvements
  • Coordinate process and procedures with various Operation Centers

Minimum Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in program or project management in the software industry
  • 5+ years of experience with incident management in a SaaS environment
  • Experience owning program strategy, end to end delivery, and communicating results to senior leadership
  • Demonstrated experience working with cross-functional teams to design and launch initiatives
  • Excellent written, presentation, and verbal communication skills

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Practical application of program management methodology including agile at scale
  • Demonstrated ability working in an ambiguous environment with ability to think strategically and execute methodically
  • Experience handling changing priorities and using good judgment when working in stressful situations
  • Proven ability to influence internal/external stakeholders without authority to adopt new processes/initiatives
  • High attention to detail including proven ability to manage multiple competing projects and priorities simultaneously
  • Demonstrated experience and proficiency in effective communication of goals and strategies across multiple leadership levels of an organization
  • Ability to build and maintain open and collaborative relationships with various levels of leadership
  • Usage of Kibana, LogicMonitor, Mixpanel, or similar monitoring tools
  • Familiarity with implementation and usage of On-Call Alerting tools like PagerDuty, OpsGenie, etc.

job_description:
Technology Services Group - Moody's Analytics Delivery

 

Role/Responsibilities:
The Data Integration MuleSoft Software Engineer is hybrid either Charlotte, NC or Toronto, Canada, is responsible for designing, developing, and implementing data integration solutions that enable seamless data flow and information sharing between various systems, applications, and data sources within an organization. This role requires a understanding of data integration methodologies, tools, and best practices, as well as technical, analytical, and communication skills. The Data Integration Engineer will work closely with cross-functional teams, including data architects, data analysts, and business stakeholders, to ensure data integrated accurately and efficiently, while maintaining data quality and integrity.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Define and implement data integration strategies, processes, and standards to support the organization's data management objectives.
  • Design, develop, and maintain data integration solutions, including ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, data pipelines, and APIs, using various data integration tools and programming languages.
  • Collaborate with data architects and analysts to understand data requirements, data models, and data mappings, and to ensure data integration solutions meet business needs.
  • Perform data profiling, cleansing, and transformation to ensure data quality and integrity during the integration process.
  • Monitor and optimize data integration performance, troubleshoot, and resolve data integration issues.
  • Evaluate and recommend new data integration tools, technologies, and best practices to improve data integration efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, business stakeholders, and data governance teams, to ensure data integration solutions align with enterprise architecture and data governance policies.
  • Develop and maintain documentation for data integration processes, including data flow diagrams, data dictionaries, and technical specifications.
  • Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data integration and data management.

 

Qualifications :

  • Bachelor's or master’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field.
  • Hands-on experience in data integration, ETL processes, and data warehousing.
  • Knowledge of data integration tools and technologies, such as Informatica, MuleSoft, SSIS.
  • Integration and data migration experience with Salesforce application is preferable.
  • Proficiency in programming languages, such as SQL, Python, or XML.
  • Proficiency in Databases like SQL Server and other cloud databases like snowflake, RedShift are preferred.
  • Familiarity with data modeling, data quality, and data governance concepts and best practices.
  • Excellent problem-solving, analytical skills

The VP – Service Delivery (GRE/Infrastructure) is expected to manage medium to large-sized Projects and/or Programs that are  medium to high-complexity, broad in scope, interdependent, and have medium to long term implementation time frames. The role works closely with product owners, architects, engineers, vendors/partners, and line of business stakeholders to deliver technology solutions in support of Moody’s strategic and tactical initiatives. Primary focus for a PM is to manage control scope, timeline, cost, risk, and communications throughout the project lifecycle in accordance to Moody’s internal project management framework. This role will work in conjunction with many technical and business teams but the primary focus will be on Global Real Estate projects and their technical completions. 

Organizational Responsibilities:
  • Team member role reports directly to TSG MD Strategy, Risk, and Governance.
  • Participates in Moody’s organizational events such as Quarterly Offsite and Team Meetings.
  • Represent the values of Moody’s and TSG as a professional organization and individually demonstrate professionalism and respect to their team and stakeholders.
  • Continuously improve project management methodologies used within Moody’s TSG.
  • Provide expertise and consulting to project managers in the process of project management and in the softer skills of team dynamics, team building and group motivation.
  • While reporting to Technology Services, be knowledgeable about and thoroughly represent the requirements and expectations of the Global Real Estate organization and drive their needs to conclusion utilizing the technical support teams.

Project Work/Other:
  • Part of a project team delivering Global Real Estate projects on time, budget, and scope. This may include office builds, closures, consolidations, refreshes, upgrades, etc. May also participate in M&A integration projects.
  • Responsible for working with technical functional owners to determine technical office infrastructure standards; for example IDF closet structured cabling, rack, power, and environmentals.
  • Serve as the champion and funnel point of contact for the full Global Real Estate portfolio of projects with the Technology Services Group and other stakeholders.
  • May also oversee/manage a small team of Project Managers sharing similar GRE and/or M&A Integration work.
  • Oversee/manage all phases of projects from initiation to closure with full adherence and alignment with Moody’s internal project management framework.
  • Develop / track/ manage required project documentation and provide reporting cadence and distribution structure aligned with stakeholder expectations.
  • Align and combine mutually exclusive projects into programs where applicable.
  • Ensure deliverables meet quality requirements and are clearly documented.
  • Develop and assign resourcing to activities, monitor performance.
  • Manage escalations, project/scope/requirement changes, and RAID logs to ensure adequate attention to impediments with potential impact to time/quality/resources.
  • Manage communications to all levels of stakeholders, proper issue tracking/reporting, and stakeholder validation of project progress / new business.
  • Identify opportunities for process improvements and lead efforts to communicate and implement them.
  • Participate in group portfolio planning and prioritization efforts and accurately capture and communicate project priorities.
  • Participate in vendor selection processes (including RFPs and Pricing) and manage against deliverables (including SOWs, change management, approval of deliverables).
  • Partner with stakeholders to identify areas of improvement to increase customer satisfaction and decrease incidents / requests
  • Mentor and help to develop less experienced Project Managers
Qualifications :
  • ​​​​​Ability to lead and collaboratively work with various stakeholders
  • Delivering Presentation to various audiences, including Senior Management
  • Recognized Project Management Methodology and Processes
  • Experience managing a Program and Change Management
  • Experienced with MS Office Suite
  • Understanding of various Project Management methodologies (i.e., Waterfall, RUP, Scrum)
  • Ability to read, decipher, and/or use/modify CAD drawings for use in understanding facilities requirements, interacting with vendors, and/or creating IDF closet diagrams.
  • Multi-Stakeholder Management
  • Executive Level communication and presentation
  • Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution
  • 5+ years of project management experience in a related industry, specifically with technology infrastructure and Infrastructure integration
  • Experience running and managing Infrastructure projects such as network builds, data center consolidations, office refreshes, and structured cabling.
  • Infrastructure and Facilities experience with Network, Data Center, IDF/Server Closet infrastructure, structured cabling, environmentals (power, cooling), and carrier circuitry.
  • Proven track record of being detail-oriented in project management with a demonstrated ability to self-motivate and follow through
  • Project management, Process Improvement or Quality certifications required
  • Managing project budgets and reporting
  • Proven leadership abilities across all levels of an organization, including executive level
  • Strong process orientation, problem solving and troubleshooting skills, and a firm commitment to quality
  • Client-focused

We originate thought leadership content as well as providing expertise in digital marketing and event planning, to promote engagement between our company and our customers. We’re looking for a Content Strategist with strong knowledge of the B2B decision journey, experience developing corresponding content plans, and overseeing how those plans are carried out.  This strategist will develop the content/storytelling agenda for Moody’s marketing campaigns across a variety of media, including written, video, and live events.  The successful candidate is passionate about being a brand advocate, is highly creative, and has the ability to translate technical information into compelling stories that deliver results.

What you’ll do:

  • Develop a plan for campaign content & oversee execution by partnering with SME’s or other assigned content producers/owners
  • Interact with various project teams to understand business objectives and audience
  • Collaborates with business unit leaders to ideate, create and produce strategic content assets. 
  • Delivers results that increase awareness of, affinity for, and reason for business customers to choose Moody’s.
  • Makes an ongoing effort to understand and stay up-to-date on the business, brand, products, and customers; keeping informed of industry trends and marketing approaches. 

 

What you’ve got:

  • Five or more years marketing communications experience in a technology focused B2B business
  • Experience with telling a story using words, images, and/or video and an understanding of how to create content that draws an audience, leveraging analytics to inform continuous improvement
  • Deep knowledge of a variety of marketing channels, including social, email, digital, events, paid media, etc., and how best to leverage content within each
  • Technology experience a plus
  • Proven ability to understand, synthesize, and reorganize complex information
  • Team oriented - ability to motivate and work well with diverse, cross-functional teams
  • Knowledge of and ability to work with designers so visual elements complement written content
  • Strong organizational and project management skills, able to plan, meet deadlines, and prioritize projects
  • Leadership skills to shape/lead growth vision and marketing strategy
  • Outstanding written and oral communication skills

job_description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

this is a hybrid role requiring 2-3 days onsite in the NYC office 

 

The Role / Responsibilities:

 

The Internal Audit Manager manages the day to day execution of integrated financial, operational, and regulatory audits. 

 

Manages Audit Lifecycle:

 

Lead moderately complex audit projects, from planning to reporting, utilizing a risk-based approach. Prepares and communicates audit testing approach, develops audit engagement budget and timelines, supervises and/or executes audit field work.

Confirm audit observations with management, including agreement of the facts around potential issues, develop the ‘why do we care’  for audit issues, and collaborate with stakeholders to develop meaningful recommendations and prepare draft audit report.

Technical Knowledge: Demonstrates strong understanding of risk and controls across a variety of risk areas. Maintains an understanding of the financial, operational, and technology processes, risks and controls related to Moody's business. Ability to identify key risks and leading practices for the area under review.

 

Stakeholder Relationships: Develop relationship with audit stakeholders, manages stakeholder expectations and aligns audit projects based on stakeholders objective of the area under review. Runs meetings with stakeholders, and has persuasive conversations with stakeholders around the ‘why do we care’ for audit issues. Supports team leads in educating stakeholders on best practices in governance, risk and control.

 

Data Analytics: Continuously expands knowledge of data analytics and use of technology to enhance audit testing, identify opportunities for continuous monitoring and repeatable test plans. Capable of performing intermediate level data analytics functions within Excel or equivalent applications (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, etc)

 

Additional Responsibilities:

 

Assists in developing or supporting other IA deliverables i.e. local/regional regulators requests, board materials.

Leads and/or supports execution of innovative solutions on projects and supports IA management team in overall change management.

Assists with enhancing the internal audit standards, processes, templates and audit techniques to increase overall efficiency and quality of internal audit delivery.

Coaches junior staff members through the audit lifecycle, including communicating roles and expectations for project team at the start of the project, reinforcing accountability of project deliverables, hours, cost and cycle time, developing test steps, reviewing workpapers and providing feedback. Acts as a role model by exemplifying high performance for team members.

Qualifications:

 

Bachelor's degree

CPA, CA, CIA, CISA or equivalent professional qualification required

5+ years of relevant audit experience (preferrably in a Big 4 Accounting firm and/or a global organization) within an audit, risk or controls role.

Experience performing both Operational/Financial Audits as well as Technology Audits will be advantageous

Good knowledge of internal controls, internal controls framework and risk standards (e.g. COSO, ISO, NIST etc.), Sarbanes Oxley Act, regulations pertaining to financial services industry, GAAP and financial systems and related technology

Experience in performing assurance related work over software development, SaaS solutions, cloud, and data processes would be advantageous. Working knowledge in these areas through other roles (e.g. compliance, risk management, consulting) are also valuable.

Awareness of regulations pertaining to financial services and fintech industry

Knowledgeable on the Risk Assessment process

Ability to lead meetings with stakeholders as well as IA management team

Experience drafting reports/memos/recommendations to stakeholders

Proficiency in financial systems and Microsoft Office suite are required. 

Ability to work both independently and as a member of a team in a fast paced environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.  

Candidate should be innovative, result oriented and should be able to demonstrate strong communication, interpersonal, persuasion, leadership, team management, project management and critical thinking skills.

Fluent in written and spoken English

The Department / Team

 

The Moody’s Internal Audit team is dedicated to providing independent, objective assurance and advisory services designed to add value and improve the Company’s operations and the effectiveness of the control, risk management, and compliance processes.

 

 

 

#LI-BR2

Role/Responsibilities:

The Digital Insights OU is hiring for an initiative to increase recognition of Moody’s value proposition among a wide range of financial market participants by providing highest level of financials data governance and ensure data quality and usability of our products.

The Data Operations Specialist will work within an initiative focused in analyzing published financial documents of corporate entities around the globe. The role will leverage competency in accounting, capital markets, and financial statement analysis to extract relevant data and insights from published documents. The ideal candidate will possess a goal-oriented mindset, an interest in growing their competency and career, and a desire to collaborate with a global team, particularly partnering with the Data Operations Lead/SME and the Data Operations Manager.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyzing and extracting data, insights, and other information from financial documents
  • Reviewing financial documents which include Income Statement, Balance Sheet and Cash Flow Statement from the annual/interim and regulatory statements of entities across the world
  • Knowledge of US GAAP, local GAAP, and/or IFRS, is required (knowledge of several and others is a bonus)
  • Conducting detailed quality checks of own work, as well as others is required
  • Adhering to timeliness deadlines with quality output is a primary characteristic of the work
  • Ability to work independently and in a global team
Qualifications :

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field required

Languages:

  • English: Advanced written and verbal command
  • Spanish: Advanced written and verbal command
  • Business proficiency in other languages a plus

Skills and Experience

  • 1-3 years of experience of analyzing financial statements
  • Advanced understanding of various company filings (10K, annual reports, Solvency reports) and should be comfortable with secondary research
  • Hands on experience extracting pertinent insights from financial statements
  • Knowledge of accounting/financial documents
  • Superior attention to detail, analytical ability and problem-solving skills
  • Organized, dependable, able to multi-task and manage priorities, display initiative, and the ability to work independently
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office products and particularly Excel, such as pivot tables, lookups, etc.

Role/Responsibilities

The Moody’s Summer Associate internship program is a 10-week program that provides an outstanding opportunity to develop skills that are valuable to any future career in the financial services industry. This will be an internally facing role, reporting to a Team Manager.
The Summer Associate will be assigned to one of the following rating groups:

  • Corporate Finance Group (CFG)
  • Financial Institutions Group (FIG)
  • Public Finance Group (PFG)
  • Project and Infrastructure (PIF)
  • Structured Finance Group (SFG)
  • Sovereign Group (SOV)
  • Sub-Sovereign Group (SubSOV)

The successful Summer Intern can aspire to receive an offer to join Moody’s as an Associate Analyst after they graduate.

 

Key Responsibilities
Supporting Analytical teams as needed. Examples of analytical work may include:

  • Participate in case studies designed to further analytical understanding
  • Work on various analytical, research, data, process related projects
  • Collect data and identify trends to support well-thought-out credit conclusions
  • Prepare financial documents, charts, and presentations
  • Responsible for monitoring media outlets for news regarding special projects or portfolios
  • Provide analytical and research support to the rating teams
  • Contribute to the creation of high-quality research publications

  • Students working towards a Bachelor’s Degree, or equivalent qualification, or a Master’s Degree, in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Political Economy, International Relations, Statistics, or another quantitative field
  • Graduation date of December 2024 – June 2025
  • Good accounting or statistics background (e.g., through coursework, CFA (or equivalent) may be required for some, but not all teams
  • Strong analytical skills

  • Strong experience working in Agile environments, JIRA, Confluence.

Team/Department Description:
Moody's Shared Services- Finance
 
Role/Responsibilities:
The Manager will provide intermediate and advanced support through all phases of the financial planning and analysis processes including business partnering and working on cross functional projects. The Manager is in charge of business forecasting and corresponding budgets as well as performance-based analyses. The FP&A Manager aims to predict future financial outcomes by considering economic and business trends, reviewing past company performance, in the forecasting and budgeting process. 

Key Responsibilities:
Support the execution of financial planning and analysis processes, projects, and ad-hoc requests as required by the Finance organization by embracing the following responsibilities: 
•    Lead the preparation of the monthly reports and variance analysis, in a timely manner.  Including the use of financial KPI analysis and identifying historical trends that will offer value added insights and help identify key focus areas for management
•    Execute business planning processes and deliverables: forecast, budget, 5-year strategic plan, etc. Deliver driver based presentational outputs for discussion with senior management
•    Actively partner with the local, regional and global contacts and communicate effectively with the business to foster good working relationships with the rest of the organization
•    Develop new reporting solutions
•    Play a key role to proactively lead and evaluate the recommendation and implementations of best practices for enhancements to current processes and reporting, including identifying areas for productivity and driving the standardization of activities across business planning to harness efficiencies
•    Strategize and execute on special projects as assigned by Senior Finance management

Qualifications:
•    Post-graduate qualification in Finance, Accounting, Statistics or other quantitative field (e.g. MBA, CPA/CA, CIMA, ACCA)
•    5+ years of relevant experience in Financial Planning and analysis processes and modelling, or equivalent.
•    Business intelligence tools, and data science experience is as well as SQL and Alteryx skills are a plus
•    Exposure to multidimensional reporting applications is essential (e.g. Hyperion Planning and Essbase)
•    Detail and data quality oriented and capable to summarize and effectively communicate findings/analysis to senior stakeholder management
•    Proficiency in Microsoft Office (preferably: Office 365), financial modeling and related financial systems
•    Advanced analytical decision-making, and problem-solving skills

The Sr Data Governance Analyst will support MIS Tech in establishing and adhering to data governance standards that facilitate delivery of fit for purpose data across applications to business stakeholders.  The role will serve as a key contact person between the various business and technical teams and requires a self-motivated individual with a diverse skillset.  Skills needed for the job include eliciting data requirements, validating and documenting the requirements, creating data mappings, creating process and data flows, assisting with Data Modeling and providing testing assistance.  The role will also regularly work with IT developers, business analysts, data modelers, and Enterprise Data Management resources to ensure that both the business needs and MIS Tech strategic objectives are met.


Key responsibilities for this role include the following:
  • Contributes to data and IT projects as a business-minded analyst, performing full lifecycle analysis including data profiling, requirements gathering and documenting, data mappings, process and data design flows, data quality controls input, and testing assistance
  • Establish and maintain a strong understanding of Moody’s business processes and data needs of the assigned business project and/or MIS Strategic objective
  • Work with leadership and stakeholders to establish Data Domains, Data Ownership and Data Quality metrics.
  • Help establish governance of data feeds from third party vendors to ensure traceability, ownership and compliance in partnership with business, vendor mgmt. and compliance/audit.
  • Partner with Enterprise Data Management to establish standards and capture appropriate metadata in Collibra for all MIS data assets and create process to manage this on an ongoing basis.
  • Provide support as needed on data projects, analyzing data needs and evaluating third party data feeds for usability.
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
  • Support data requests/projects and helps to interpret data sets
  • Perform ad-hoc data/process analysis as needed
  • Participate in Agile scrum teams and contribute to project planning and work prioritization
Qualifications :
  • Bachelor's degree in Technology, Engineering or related field, or equivalent experience
  • 5+ years of Data Governance Analyst experience (data governance standards, data quality, data mapping, data lineage.)
  • Must have strong experience with Collibra
  • Experience with SQL a must, experience with Data Profiling, Data Reporting tools a plus
  • Financial Services industry experience a plus
  • Experience working with third party data providers a plus.
  • Knowledge of Python, AWS tools and services, and modern data architecture concepts (such as Microservices Architecture) a plus.
  • Strong experience working in Agile environments, experience with design thinking.
  • Ability to coordinate and assist teams to resolve complex analytical and technical issues
  • Excellent communication skills, the ability to translate technical concepts to business concepts and vice versa
  • Client focused, proactive, and results oriented
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite

The Department / Team:
The Software Engineer will be member Software Engineering team in our R&D centre based in Grenoble and dedicated to develop Moody's Analytics Solutions across the EMEA region. He will also be part of a multidisciplinary team built to the agile SCRUM design. The Software Engineer will work in cooperation with our architects, development engineers and quality engineers in a multicultural environment.

 

The Role / Responsibilities:
In order to support our new generation products fitted for high performance and scalability, we are recruiting a subject matter expert in backend development . 
You will integrate a software development team in charge of the development of our new risk management platform based on SaaS technologies. 
As an expert you will take part of the development of Moody’s new solution with a particular focus on the development of web services mechanisms allowing to manage the computation and the aggregation of risk indicators with the objective to publish regulatory reports.
Your position will allow you to interact with architect, business analysts, project managers, developers, and quality assurance analysts of different geographic development sites

As Senior Software Engineer, you will : 

  • Collaborate with Business Analysts to interpret requirements for Business Missions/Epics owned by the stream.
  • Provide feedback on requirements from a technical perspective and provide estimates for user stories and tasks.
  • Lead design activities for Business Missions/Epics owned by the stream
  • Take ownership of business missions/epics and stories; Implement and test features based on the requirements
  • Define and maintain coding standards, and guide team members to comply with these standards.
  • Collaborate with quality assurance engineers to fix defects.
  • Collaborate with build and release engineers to prepare packages and solve environment issues.
  • Investigate and find the root cause for software problems reported by clients. Communicate with clients via email and phone regarding these defects.
  • Maintain technical documents..
  • Review code, lead refactoring activities, provide guidance from technical perspective for all SE members of a stream
  • Work with more senior team members to continuously improve our engineering practices
  • Conduct training sessions and knowledge sharing in or cross the teams.

Qualifications:

  • Owner of a Master’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering, you already have a solid experience  on Python.  Experience in AWS Cloud computing, PostgreSQL and usage of Git are mandatory.

Additional language requirement:

  • Knowledge of Scala will be a good additional skill.

Additional skills :

  • Usage of Github actions and interest for DevOps tools will be appreciated.
  • Some notions in Angular will be appreciated.
  • A good English communication level is required.
  • Good interpersonal skills and the ability to build strong professional relationships at all levels.

summary_job_summary: Spearheading work on the training and support of our clients in relation to insurance focused stochastic modelling products, models and calibrations. This includes hosting and co-ordination of onsite training sessions and the delivery of training on these products and their underlying quantitative modelling techniques. In addition, there will be responsibility for the development, maintenance and delivery of training and support to our clients.
job_google_locations: [{'city': 'New York', 'state': 'NY', 'zip': '10007', 'country': 'US', 'address': '7 World Trade Center, 250 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10007, USA', 'location': [-74.0119311, 40.7134166]}]
job_description:
The Role / Responsibilities:

This is an excellent opportunity to join the Insurance Advisory Services and Customer Success Team. As a member of the team, you will be at the forefront of industry developments and will be exposed to ground-breaking stochastic modelling and risk management problems.

The candidate will take a leading role in implementation and advisory projects, client training and direct client engagement. The role will coordinate the production of customized calibrations and scenario sets, software configurations, client on-boarding and general quantitative support. In addition, the role includes working with our sales team to advocate for our quantitative modelling expertise and capabilities.

Leading consulting, implementation, model calibration and client facing projects within the Insurance Services team. This is through a combination of direct client work and through leading junior team members in projects to implement stochastic modelling software and content solutions for actuarial pricing, capital, asset allocation and risk management applications.
Spearheading work on the training and support of our clients in relation to insurance focused stochastic modelling products, models and calibrations. This includes hosting and co-ordination of onsite training sessions and the delivery of training on these products and their underlying quantitative modelling techniques. In addition, there will be responsibility for the development, maintenance and delivery of training and support to our clients.
Working with the sales team to engage with prospects in meetings/workshops to support the use of our products and content-services. Position requires travel within North America which is largely self-managed and planned in advance.
Working with the sales team to define solutions and draft technical specifications for commercial agreements.
Maintain and develop client relationships and key partner relationships across the insurance and wider Moody's business. This includes forming relationships at a technical level as well as a business level with key decision makers. 
Working directly with clients to support the implementation, training, documentation and validation of our insurance focused stochastic modelling products and services. Projects are multifaceted and can involve a combination of activities run from our Moody’s Analytics offices and also onsite with clients.
Lead junior team members and provide quality assurance on analytical work for clients based on the application of financial modelling to life insurance, asset allocation and risk management problems. This will include use of the Moody’s Analytics Scenario Generator and wide stochastic modelling tool kit in the following areas:
Configuring solutions for clients and working with them to implement our solutions.
Working with our modelling operations team to configure customized content services
Development and advisory projects with regard to tailored modelling and calibration services

Engaging with key collaborators across our research and product development teams to represent our client ‘voice’ in the development of our software and content solutions with a focus on the North American Insurance market. 


Qualifications / Experience:


Master’s degree in quantitative subject (financial mathematics, mathematics, physics, etc.). 
Significant progress towards achieving a professional qualification – Actuarial, CFA etc. 
Insight and knowledge of the modelling used in the Life Insurance, P&C, Asset Management and Pensions sector.
Experience in a financial institution (e.g., within an insurance company, consulting firm or financial software provider)
Understanding of financial mathematics e.g., derivative pricing, interest-rate modelling, econometrics, stochastic processes, Monte-Carlo simulation.
Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to bridge teams from different backgrounds and at all levels. 
Excellent analytical skills including experience with data analysis, econometric techniques and statistical methods.
Experience of mentoring, project management or project lead roles with internal and external partners 
Experience of working with commercial teams to define technical specification for projects and services
Experience of using and calibrating Moody’s Scenario Generator is advantageous. 
Strong understanding of the usage and applicability of a Scenario Generator in the North American insurance market. 
An in-depth knowledge of the regulatory and competitive landscape of Scenario Generation in Insurance.
Experience in one or more programming languages such as Python, VBA, C# etc.
Experience in statistical software packages such as R.
Efficient approach to problem solving
Can be relied upon to meet targets while maintaining high standards
Desire to innovate and discuss ideas
Excellent interpersonal skills, both verbal and written, including the ability to connect with people from different backgrounds and at all levels
A natural curiosity about the development and success of others 
Open to using new methodologies
Unwavering dedication to customer service

As a QA Associate, you will work in a dedicated team supporting a global Quality Assurance (QA) framework. In this role you will be required to understand an operational process, identify inconsistencies based on understanding MIS policies and procedures, liaise with global stakeholders to investigate and remediate inconsistencies, provide a high level of service and track and report on activity.
Responsibilities Include:
•    Source required documents to perform a QA review including outreach to internal customers if needed.
•    Perform QA reviews based on a defined process and applying a solid understanding of regulatory/ compliance requirements.
•    Well-developed ability/aptitude to perform QA reviews with a high level of accuracy; maintain capture rate of 99.5% or greater in identifying documentation inconsistencies
•    Record observations in a comprehensive manner to facilitate hand offs and follow ups. 
•    Proactively liaise with Credit Rating Analysts and partner groups to investigate inconsistencies, discuss MIS policies, procedures and guidelines, and remediate inconsistencies prior to set deadlines. 
•    Develop subject matter expertise to facilitate educated decision-making and discussions when faced with an exceptional scenario not covered by the process steps
•    Collaborate with local and regional team members to solve problems, build consensus on and make recommendations for a path forward when faced with an obstacle or new scenario.
•    Actively liaise with team leaders and managers to discuss and resolve open questions and brainstorm ideas/opportunities to improve and strengthen the operating environment
•    Build knowledge and understanding of the tactical tools and broader operating environment including the MIS Credit Rating Process and related Policies, Procedures and Guidelines
•    Identify and proactively research issues, exceptions, and data discrepancies; escalate as needed and follow up to resolve
•    Support the manager with developing and updating process documentation (e.g. guidelines, FAQ’s, manuals). Make recommendations for efficiency opportunities.

Qualifications:
•    Postgraduate in any stream with ~3 years of work experience, or graduate with minimum 4 years of work experience, with good academic record
•    Prior experience in Quality Assurance profile and/or relevant internship experience a plus.
•    Able to confidently follow a complex process and rapidly develop subject matter expertise without the need for continual quality checks on work. 
•    Excellent attention to detail and ability to complete transactional processes without concentration lapses
•    Highly organized and efficient; able to complete multiple in-progress deliverables and move them  forward
•    Strong performer with aim to learn and grow with the organization
•    Strong MS office skills, intermediate to advanced Excel skills and Power Point preferred
•    Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to confidently put across the view point without getting intimidated by seniority or role of the audience
•    Solid presentation skills; capable of presenting points in concise and structured manner
•    Willing to take ownership and pride in the process and the team’s deliverables, and motivated to provide a high level of service
•    Resourceful and proactive, continually seeking ways to make improvements in the process/team/work environment
•    Strong interpersonal skills; ability to work well within a team atmosphere as a supportive, helpful team member
•    Capable of managing and prioritizing high workload volumes

Opportunity for a senior market facing role to manage the overall relationship with key Intermediaries for Moody’s Investors Service (MIS) in the EMEA region – banks and private equity firms. Responsible for the development and execution of a dedicated outreach strategy to key rating advisory teams and private equity/credit firms across EMEA. Key objective is maximising the impact of intermediary relationships for MIS.

Reporting line:

This position reports to the SVP-RM, Head of Leveraged Finance and Intermediaries, EMEA Commercial Group

Scope:

  • Managing relationships with Tier 1 Intermediary banks and private equity firms in EMEA.
  • Plan and execute a strategic outreach plan to target banks and private equity firms.
  • Communication of MIS value proposition, product and pricing policies to Intermediaries
  • Conduit for two-way information flow between the MIS Commercial Group and Intermediaries
  • Acting as first point of contact for Intermediary feedback to key stakeholders within MIS.
  • Expand MIS Commercial reach into Debt Syndicate, Debt Origination and ESG advisory and arranging functions
  • Facilitate appropriate engagement with Intermediaries for analytical teams.
  • Expect to spend minimum of 30% of time meeting intermediaries, particularly in London/Paris.
  • Coordinate with North America, LatAm and APAC counterparts to inform global view of Intermediary relationships and strategic engagement plans.
  • Provide active support to the LBO and RAS Desks on transaction execution
  • Support relationship managers in Business Development across EMEA
  • Support EMEA Business Coordinators and Specialists with Intermediaries.
  • Act as RM for selected [UK & Ireland] Issuer relationships.

 

Qualifications:

  • Senior individual contributor
  • Expertise in EMEA debt capital markets
  • Credit expertise and ability to demonstrate knowledge of MIS corporate finance methodologies
  • Experience in sales and marketing
  • Experience in financial services industry
  • Excellent written and spoken English essential; additional European languages desirable.
  • Undergraduate / First Level degree (or equivalent) required
  • Masters or CFA desirable

 

 

Requirements:

  • Independently maintain active relationships with Intermediaries at all levels.
  • Ability to effectively chair several meetings daily with different Intermediaries and customers
  • Excellent communication, negotiation, influencing and organisational skills

The Data Solutions division is the commercial data business of Moody’s Analytics, bringing together a vast catalogue of data to help business decision-makers assess risks and opportunities. We are best known for Orbis, the world’s most comprehensive database of public and private companies.
