The Role / Responsibilities:

  • Meet or exceed goals and targets that align with the company’s vision and objectives.
  • Reach out to prospects via telephone and email to generate new leads.
  • Qualify new business opportunities and set up web meetings for demonstrations of Moody’s Analytics Pulse solution.

Role/Responsibilities:

The Digital Insights OU is hiring for an initiative to increase recognition of Moody’s value proposition among a wide range of financial market participants by providing highest level of financials data governance and ensure data quality and usability of our products.

The Data Operations Specialist will work within an initiative focused in analyzing published financial documents of corporate entities around the globe. The role will leverage competency in accounting, capital markets, and financial statement analysis to extract relevant data and insights from published documents. The ideal candidate will possess a goal-oriented mindset, an interest in growing their competency and career, and a desire to collaborate with a global team, particularly partnering with the Data Operations Lead/SME and the Data Operations Manager.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyzing and extracting data, insights, and other information from financial documents
  • Reviewing financial documents which include Income Statement, Balance Sheet and Cash Flow Statement from the annual/interim and regulatory statements of entities across the world
  • Knowledge of US GAAP, local GAAP, and/or IFRS, is required (knowledge of several and others is a bonus)
  • Conducting detailed quality checks of own work, as well as others is required
  • Adhering to timeliness deadlines with quality output is a primary characteristic of the work
  • Ability to work independently and in a global team
Qualifications :

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field required

Languages:

  • English: Advanced written and verbal command
  • Spanish: Advanced written and verbal command
  • Business proficiency in other languages a plus

Skills and Experience

  • 1-3 years of experience of analyzing financial statements
  • Advanced understanding of various company filings (10K, annual reports, Solvency reports) and should be comfortable with secondary research
  • Hands on experience extracting pertinent insights from financial statements
  • Knowledge of accounting/financial documents
  • Superior attention to detail, analytical ability and problem-solving skills
  • Organized, dependable, able to multi-task and manage priorities, display initiative, and the ability to work independently
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office products and particularly Excel, such as pivot tables, lookups, etc.

job_description:
This associate of Marketing Campaigns is critical in supporting a foundation of excellence through the creation and delivery of various marketing programs and email campaigns within our marketing automation platform. This role will work on supporting email campaign creation, including the creation of emails, landing pages, automation triggers, and reporting. The associate will work collaboratively with marketing leaders and specialists to define, create, deploy, and report campaign programs and email campaigns, ensuring quality and excellence while also assessing performance in order to continually improve and optimize campaign activity.

 

  • Support the day-to-day creation, editing, execution and reporting of marketing campaigns using various program types in Marketo (including Email, Content, Webinars, Events, Conferences, Paid, etc.).
  • Collaborate with marketing colleagues across various operating units to plan for effective marketing campaigns that leverage the capabilities of our digital marketing technology platforms
  • Assist with email campaign strategy and execution; including planning, executing, testing, and optimizing recurring and email campaigns.
  • Contribute to the management of a campaign calendar provide coordinating oversight of email campaigns, monitor email frequency for each target audience, and set expectations for stakeholders across marketing, sales, and product teams to eliminate noise in email marketing efforts.
  • Generate email marketing KPI reports. Contribute to the analysis and reporting of campaign performance, including evaluating the effectiveness and making observations and suggestions for campaign optimization and improvement.
  • Assist with list management, lead scoring, and  and provide support to all email marketing activities for internal and external marketing.
  • Proficient in project management software (Jira is an asset) and related documents in Microsoft Office applications including internal email announcements (Outlook), budget spreadsheets (Excel), legal approval comments/tracking (Word), presentation formatting and content updates (PowerPoint).

 

Experience Required

  • Designing, testing and executing end-to-end marketing automation campaigns at enterprise level.
  • Familiarity with email marketing best practices, design standards and reporting, with experience editing HTML.
  • Proven success in driving results-oriented marketing programs and strategies, and the ability to proactively identify opportunities for improvement and optimization.
  • Experience in using B2B marketing automation technologies .
  • Project management skills and strong attention to detail. Demonstrated ability to manage logistics, tactical details with excellence.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

 

Qualifications

  • Marketo Associate/Expert Certification is an asset
  • Minimum 3+ years of experience in B2B marketing automation or email marketing technology, ideally at an enterprise-level
  • Hands-on experience with CRM, list management, and Salesforce and integrations with other parts of the martech stack
  • Proven ability to collaborate with others and be a strong individual contributor
  • Passionate about operational excellence and process improvement and interested in demonstrating your experience to help execute best-in-class campaigns
  • Bring a data-driven approach with an eye on process optimization and change management

Senior Systems Engineer – Collaboration Engineering (Hybrid) 

Senior Engineers at Moody’s can use cutting-edge technology while working on high performance/low latency systems. Moody’s loves Senior Engineers who are self-starters, can problem solve and think outside of the box. You’ll also be working on data aggregation projects, rollout of entire new products, continuous service improvements and bots within our tools. We value innovation and hard work and want you to make an impact on the firm. Whether you are interested in Collaboration tools, messaging, performance engineering, hardware or data capture and analysis, there's work to be done. If you are excited to jump in and make a difference, Moody’s could be the place for you! 

We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Senior Systems Engineer with subject matter expertise with Messaging/Mobility/Collaboration systems including: 

  • Office 365 – Exchange Hybrid, Teams, SharePoint Online, OneDrive, Modern Apps, M365 Copilot, Viva Suite, Tenant to Tenant Migrations 

  • Azure AD / AD Connect Concepts and Understanding 

  • Mobility – iOS/Android, Microsoft Intune Management of Corp/BYO devices 

  • Messaging Compliance in regulated industries – M365 E-Discovery/Purview, or comparable platform 

 
The candidate will be joining a very dynamic environment where they will be expected to take on challenges, be able to comfortably multitask, prioritize many different project/daily tasks and deliver on time. The candidate is expected to be able to independently lead projects from start to end (technology research, tool selection, solution design, solution engineering, testing, implementation and hand over to operations). 

Innovation and the eagerness to continuously keep up to date with the most cutting-edge technologies are among the key qualities that this candidate must have.  
 

Responsibilities: 

  • Delivery of effective Messaging and Collaboration solutions as well as creation of associated design and operating documentation 

  • Expert technical knowledge and troubleshooting skills of Office 365, Teams, Exchange Hybrid (2019), Active Directory, Azure AD, Azure AD Connect, MDM Management, PowerShell & Graph API Automation 

  • Advanced knowledge of MS Teams Administration & Polices, Mail flow, email hygiene, SMTP, TLS, Outlook functionality, M365 Retention & Compliance 

  • Provide SME level expertise to different Moody's teams as it relates to M365 Collaboration 

  • Perform periodic infrastructure applications assessments and documentation review as part of our application governance 

  • Keep up-to-date on current and upcoming features in relevant products and platforms 
    Integrating M365 Suite with workflow applications such as ServiceNow, using orchestration tools. 

  • Effectively and independently take on and manage tasks/work inside multiple projects simultaneously 

  • Work seamlessly with other Moody's IT teams on complex engineering projects 

  • Triage of complex technical issues related to messaging and Infrastructure applications and a multitude of other variables in the mix 

  • Ability to prioritize and work under pressure is crucial 

  • Contribute to the tech strategy and approach for our new ways of working and the future of work 

  • Work in dev, sandbox and production environments with adherence to policies for each 

 

Qualifications: 

  • Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or Equivalent area of study 

  • Minimum 6-8 years in IT industry in windows based environments 

  • Minimum 3 years in a senior engineering role 

  • Microsoft 365 Certifications 

  • Strong understanding and experience on Microsoft core infrastructure, M365 Technologies, Windows Security 

  • Proven expertise with Microsoft Exchange 2019/EXO, Teams, Azure AD Conditional Access, Intune Mobile Device Management 

  • Proven expertise with Microsoft core infra applications like Active Directory / GPO / PKI / DNS / Failover Clustering/IIS 

  • Excellent understanding of security and authentication protocols (Kerberos, LDAP, NTLM, OAuth, SSH, HTTPS, SIP, SSL etc.) 

  • Proficiency with Teams/Exchange Management Shell, O365/Azure PowerShell scripting 

  • Expertise with Windows security, OS/ M365/Application hardening and management 

  • Ability to be able to document, diagram, and flowchart complex design concepts is a must 

  • Basic understanding of network concepts (VLANs/Routing/TCP/IP/Load Balancing/Traffic Analysis etc.) is required 

  • Basic understanding of other Core security concepts (IP Sec, VPNs, Firewalls, DMZ, Proxy, Vulnerabilities, attacks) is required 

  • Windows OS expertise (Win10, Server 2016), MAC OS expertise is a plus 

  • Strong communication; verbal, written and collaboration skills 

  • Ability to effectively present information in both technical and non-technical terms 

  • Ability to evaluate solutions from both an engineering and business / end-user perspective 

  • Capacity to organize and lead efforts of L3 Collaboration & Mobility Engineering group 

 

WORKWEEK & HOURS: 

40 hours - Mon – Fri. Shift flexibility is required depending on business requirements. Must be flexible to work additional hours as required to meet project deadlines. 

Perform all other duties and responsibilities as required by the immediate manager/supervisor. 

Location: Costa Rica office minimum 2 days a week / hybrid  

 

Actual salaries will vary and will be based on various factors, such as candidate’s qualifications, skills, and competencies. The salary is one component of Moody’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards and benefits include the following: Medical, Personal Accident, Life Insurance and Time Off.

job_description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. At Moody’s Analytics KYC OU, we have the most extensive company and corporate structure information combined with sanctions and other adverse data on third parties, and the individuals behind them. We help customers effectively assess, screen, and monitor the individuals and companies they do business with. We provide best-in-class tools and data, empowering our customers to understand the risks associated with their customers, suppliers, and extended network. 

Our customers range from the biggest global banks to small fintech start-ups and our data helps to minimize their reputational risk exposure. 

We are a team made up of dedicated project managers, implementation specialists and product strategists, who are all passionate about understanding and meeting our customers’ business needs.

We are looking for a technically proficient and customer-focused Product Consultant to join the Know Your Customer (KYC) Solutions Delivery Team. The Product Consultant will be responsible for gaining an understanding of the system specifications and capabilities of MA’s KYC products, so that customers experience a top-notch implementation and access to world class ongoing technical assistance. They will work closely with Implementation Specialists and Project Managers on the KYC Solutions Delivery team to ensure clients are integrated and implemented as seamlessly as possible with their purchased solution(s).

Core Responsibilities:

  • Work with Implementation Specialists and Project Managers for new implementations/existing client change requests
  • Point of escalation for support tickets via a dedicated queue for customer queries relating to API integrations and data feeds, and triaging when necessary to other relevant teams within the KYC OU
  • Collaborate with Product teams to ensure the Solutions Delivery team has documented processes for any new products, releases and upgrades
  • Maintenance and improvement of Solutions Delivery technical documentation, including updating existing manuals and guides, as well as creating new documentation to reflect changes or additions to our systems and processes.
  • Improving system efficiency by consulting with end-users and providing innovative solutions
  • Work closely with other internal stakeholders on the fulfilment, support, engineering and operations teams
  • Assist with AI Review model training during implementations
  • Joining implementation/project calls to provide product expertise, as required

Qualifications:

  • A bachelor's degree business, computer science, information technology, information systems, computer engineering, or similar.
  • Strong knowledge of API integrations and data feeds
  • Proficiency in providing efficient web-portal support.
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, both internally and externally.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Agile and ability to learn new products & processes closely
  • Experience with CRM systems preferred.
  • Project management experience a plus.

For US-based roles only: the anticipated hiring base salary range for this position is  [[$119,200]]  to  [[$172,900]] , depending on factors such as experience, education, level, skills, and location. This range is based on a full-time position. In addition to base salary, this role is eligible for incentive compensation. Moody’s also offers a competitive benefits package, including not but limited to medical, dental, vision, parental leave, paid time off, a 401(k) plan with employee and company contribution opportunities, life, disability, and accident insurance, a discounted employee stock purchase plan, and tuition reimbursement.

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. The Data Operations Specialist will work within an initiative focused in analyzing published financial documents of corporate entities around the globe. The role will leverage competency in accounting, capital markets, and financial statement analysis to extract relevant data and insights from published documents. The ideal candidate will possess a goal-oriented mindset, an interest in growing their competency and career, and a desire to collaborate with a global team, particularly partnering with the Data Operations Lead/SME and the Data Operations Manager.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyzing and extracting data, insights, and other information from financial documents
  • Reviewing financial documents which include Income Statement, Balance Sheet and Cash Flow Statement from the annual/interim and regulatory statements of entities across the world
  • Knowledge of US GAAP, local GAAP, and/or IFRS, is required (knowledge of several and others is a bonus)
  • Conducting detailed quality checks of own work, as well as others is required
  • Adhering to timeliness deadlines with quality output is a primary characteristic of the work
  • Ability to work independently and in a global team
Qualifications :

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field required

Languages:

  • English: Advanced written and verbal command
  • Spanish: Advanced written and verbal command
  • Business proficiency in other languages a plus

Skills and Experience

  • 1-3 years of experience of analyzing financial statements
  • Advanced understanding of various company filings (10K, annual reports, Solvency reports) and should be comfortable with secondary research
  • Hands on experience extracting pertinent insights from financial statements
  • Knowledge of accounting/financial documents
  • Superior attention to detail, analytical ability and problem-solving skills
  • Organized, dependable, able to multi-task and manage priorities, display initiative, and the ability to work independently
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office products and particularly Excel, such as pivot tables, lookups, etc.

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

Role/Responsibilities:

Moody’s Investors Service Technology team seeks a Senior Software Engineer, with a strong focus on development of analytic tools and databases, to work on cutting edge projects related to structured finance analytics, performance reporting and regulation compliance.

The Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for the development and maintenance of analytic tools and databases used by analysts during the ratings process. He/she will be working with a capable team to deliver and support these custom applications. The successful candidate will lead full development cycles from requirements to delivery.

This role will suit a highly motivated problem solver with excellent communication skills and a proven ability to use his/her own initiative. The successful candidate will have a demonstrable track record of successes developing quality software solutions, liaising directly with stakeholders, and adapting to the evolving needs of the business. Ability to work without close supervision is fundamental, as well as handling communication with business stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to ongoing feature development of web applications based on service-oriented architecture, involving UI, Services and databases
  • Work with the development team leads (Lead Software Engineers) on the technical and architectural direction of projects.
  • Research, analyze, design, and deliver solutions that are appropriate for business and application development strategies.
  • Work with cross functional, globally dispersed development teams to support development efforts to meet business requirements.
  • Assist in designing and developing new projects and enhancements based on evolving business needs.
  • Interact with internal users to define system requirements and/or necessary modifications.
  • Complete documentation and procedures for installation and maintenance of software.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field.
  • 5-8 years software development experience
  • Understanding of Object-Oriented design and development
  • Understanding of Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)
  • Experience implementing web-enabled applications in ASP.NET Core, .NET Core, C#, ASP.NET, HTML5, ASP.NET MVC, JSON, REST, CSS
  • Proficient with AngularJS (Angular, React, Vue, NPM, Bower, etc.)
  • Experience with AWS and Docker highly preferred
  • Knowledge of build/dependency management tools such as Maven, SCM (Subversion, Bit Bucket)
  • Able to work well within the constructs of an agile development process, including SCRUM, Unit Testing, Continuous Build and Integration, etc.
  • Knowledge of databases: SQL, Oracle, Sybase, MySql, MongoDB, etc.
  • Experience in financial services and structured finance is advantageous
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well within a team
  • Some mathematical knowledge to understand the basic mechanics of various analytical methodologies
  • Detail oriented and highly organised

 

For US-based roles only: the anticipated hiring base salary range for this position is  [[$108,500]]  to  [[$157,250]] , depending on factors such as experience, education, level, skills, and location. Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

 

The Role / Responsibilities:

  • Application of Knowledge of Controls (including IT controls): Maintains an understanding of the financial, operational, cyber, and technology processes, risks and controls related to Moody's business. Ability to identify key risks and leading practices for the area under review. Develops test steps for the area under review commensurate with the nature of risk and risk levels. Demonstrates ability to identify potential issues and support these with data, prepare draft audit reports and communicate with stakeholders within and outside of the IA department.
  • Strong technical knowledge: Demonstrates understanding of controls across different technologies and IT infrastructure. Maintains curiosity and exercises professional scepticism, and upholds and promotes professional ethics.
  • Manages audit lifecycle: Proactively manages the end-to-end audit lifecycle, including scoping and timelines, information gathering, documentation, tests of design and operating effectiveness, and reporting. Performs audit projects in accordance with departmental and Institute of Internal Auditors standards.
  • Data Analytics: Continuously expands knowledge of data analytics and use of technology to enhance audit testing, identify opportunities for continuous monitoring and repeatable test plans. Capable of performing intermediate level data analytics functions within Excel or equivalent applications (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, etc)
  • Critical thinking: Applies process analysis, business intelligence, and problem solving techniques when planning an audit, performing walkthroughs, and identifying effective test steps. Assists in developing the “why do we care” statements for audit issues and collaborates with stakeholders and project team to develop meaningful recommendations for the audit projects.
  • Effective communication: Develops relationship with audit stakeholders and aligns audit projects based on stakeholders’ objectives of the area under review.

 

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or higher, preferably in computer science, computer engineering, information technology, information systems, or similar. 
  • Obtained or pursuing CISSP, CISA or equivalent professional qualification. CPA, ACA or CIA qualified candidates with an experience in auditing processes in IT environment. 
  • At least 3 years experience in a Big 4 Accounting firm and/or a global organization in an audit, risk or controls role.
  • Experience in performing assurance related work over software development, SaaS solutions, secure coding and cloud and data processes. Working knowledge in these areas through other roles (e.g. compliance, risk management, consulting)  within the fintech space or software and technology companies are also valuable.
  • Knowledge of internal controls, internal control frameworks and risk standards (e.g. COSO, COBIT, ISO, NIST, etc.), Sarbanes Oxley Act, and financial systems and related technology.
  • Awareness of regulations pertaining to the financial services and/or fintech industry would be beneficial
  • Knowledge of IT infrastructure controls (servers, databases, firewalls, etc.) and stays abreast of emerging technology trends (e.g. cloud, agile, AI)
  • Experience in Application Controls and IT General Controls relating to SDLC (including Agile and DevOps/DevSecOps), access/cyber, data security and integrity
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite.
  • Ability to work both independently and as a member of a team in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.   
  • An ideal candidate should be innovative, results oriented and should be able to demonstrate strong communication, interpersonal, persuasion, team management, project management and critical thinking skills.
  • Fluent in written and spoken English.

 

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_description:
Department

 

Moody’s Analytics Quantum Computing team that explores, researches, and implements quantum computing and communications solutions across the different organizational units of the company.

 

Role/Responsibilities

 

This group objective is to evaluate how quantum computing can disrupt our industry and Moody’s products in the market, evaluate the industry maturity, establish partnerships, and position Moody’s as a referent in the quantum computing sector for finance. The team creates proofs of concept and final applications that are embedded in the current classical products. Leverages our state-of-the-art financial models and our extensive datasets across the company and liaises with the different stakeholders for its productization.


In this role you will be hands-on and you will evaluate current literature, participate in the research community, and develop solutions in partnership with domain experts across the company. You are expected to have an elevated level of autonomy and capacity to learn new skills and domains including the ability to learn advanced scientific and technical concepts quickly and with minimal direction, along with demonstrated experience in teaching others. You are very passionate about quantum computing and its implications on the financial industry.

Strong technical skills and a demonstrated ability to learn new concepts is important for this position. Experience in both quantum computing and software development is essential.

Your Role will:

»  Own and lead the conception and delivery of novel solutions to problems faced by internal project teams.

»  Develop new and continually improve existing Quantum Algorithms for specific applications, in the team and in collaboration with external partners. Lead and manage the quantum innovation portfolio and pipeline, understanding the internal and external customer and business needs in order to recommend solutions where a quantum or quantum inspired approach may be optimal.

»  Provide guidance to other groups throughout Moody’s Analytics on best practices and advanced techniques.

»  Contribute to Moody’s IP by developing innovative solutions and use cases in collaboration with our partners and clients.  The goal is to transform scientific research into business value.

»  Write white papers and build and maintain relationships with the external academic community and business community.

»  Consistently scan the market / competitors / partners / research, lead client engagements to understand challenges that they are trying to address, and meet with external partners to bring new ideas and technologies to Moody’s Analytics.

»  Represent the company as a technical expert on quantum computing and present research findings to audiences internally and externally. Demonstrate thought leadership as it relates to QC, and actively seek ways to build MA’s “data and risk expertise” reputation externally (white papers, speaking panels, etc.). Partner with other ML groups inside the company to find hybrid solutions and benchmarks.

Additional Requirements:

» Performing statistical analysis on financial, climate and other type of data.
» Predictive analytics
» Conceptual modelling
» Creating examples, prototypes, demonstrations

» Have the ability to work in a fast-paced, competitive and multidisciplinary environment

» Be able to keep up with a landscape where new data/algorithms keeps flowing in rapidly and the world is constantly changing

» Ability to work equally well as part of a team and autonomously

 

Qualifications

 

»  BSc in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Math, or related field.

»  MSc, PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Math, or related field.

»  Advanced knowledge of Python, scientific computing tools and cloud computing are required.

» Previous experience with software best practices, including continuous-integration pipelines, unit testing, code review.

»  Working knowledge of quantum computing algorithms and applications. Hybrid classical/quantum algorithms are included.

»  Experience with Machine Learning / AI algorithms.

» Demonstrated knowledge and experience with Tensor Network based numerical simulation methods is a plus, with a focus on ML, optimization, function approximation and dimensionality reduction.

» Familiarity with Tensor Network libraries and/or relevant functions (ITensor, cuTensorNet, TeNPy, tntorch, scikit-tt or other toolboxes) is a plus.

» No prior familiarity with financial use cases required. Experience with financial asset allocation, predictive analytics with financial time series and risk modeling is a plus.

»  If you have open-source contributions or your own code repositories will be a plus. .

»  Experience in technical writing in a scientific or technical field. Demonstrated research ability.

»  Self-motivated with a willingness to learn.

»  Must be results-oriented and have a proven ability to get things done through people, including those not under direct management.

»  High level of professionalism.

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

Candidates for Moody’s Corporation may be asked to disclose securities holdings pursuant to Moody’s Policy for Securities Trading and the requirements of the position. Employment is contingent upon compliance with the Policy, including remediation of positions in those holdings as necessary.

Moody’s Analytics – Know Your Customer OU (KYC OU)

https://kyc.moodys.io/

At Moody’s Analytics Know Your Customer (KYC) / Know Your Supplier (KYS), we solve problems that matter. We are a cross-functional team of sales and marketing, technology and product professionals who are all passionate about preventing criminal infiltration of the world’s financial system and bringing transparency to global supply chains by detecting fraud, terrorism, human trafficking, and other criminal threats.

We combine the agility, passion, and dynamism of a startup with the strong positioning and stability of an established institution, providing our people with dynamic career paths and mobility options across the globe, all while having access to the entire Moody’s network. We empower our people and are committed to helping them reach their goals.

Role/Responsibilities;

As a Software Engineer, you will be a core member of a cross-functional team responsible for developing and executing on a vision for the PassFort product. We practice an agile, highly customer focused, and data-based approach to product development.

You will be a part of the end-to-end development of client-facing software applications, helping develop new features and product improvements. You bring not only a strong experience with algorithms, data structures, and distributed systems, but also a passion for translating those skills into business impact for our customers.

 

Specifically, you will have the opportunity to:

  • Collaborate with product managers , UX and senior engineers to define requirements and prioritize tasks
  • Design and implement technical solutions for new products and features
  • Help define testing, monitoring, and delivery plans for your work
  • Write well-designed, testable code
  • Peer review code changes
  • Learn, adapt, and propose innovative solutions to address our functional and scaling challenges
  • Champion and drive engineering processes and best practices.

 

Qualifications

  • Ability to develop software in Python, Rust, JavaScript, or other programming languages
  • Ability to design maintainable APIs
  • Experience with or willingness to learn data warehousing solutions such as Databricks, Google BigQuery, or Snowflake.
  • Solid understanding of data modelling and database systems
  • Familiarity with web technologies (or willingness to learn)
  • Experience working on a collaborative product team passionate about Agile software processes, data-driven development, and experimentation
  • Strong analytical and reasoning skills and an ability to communicate ideas to non-technical audiences
  • Ability to guide own learning and contribute to domain knowledge building


Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

Department

 

The Predictive Analytics group transforms our data into state-of-the-art analytics to help clients make better decisions in the face of uncertainty. Our clients come from a wide range of industries such as banking, insurance, commercial real estate and many more. They use our economic research to evaluate credit-worthiness, to monitor risks and opportunities when weighing up major investment decisions as part of their corporate strategy. Our team is made up of intellectually curious economists, data scientists, and IT professionals who combine technical skills with a strong desire to understand clients’ needs.

 

Role

 

Our team is directly involved in the development of analytical solutions, including credit risk metrics, supply risk, interest rate risk, liquidity risk, ESG risk and integrated risk. Our data scientists contribute to projects in every phase, including data analysis, methodology design, model development and improvements, documentation writing, results delivery, and interpretation.

We are looking for a candidate to join our Predictive Analytics (PA) Operating Unit (OU) team to support research, customer success and business development in the APAC and Middle East region. As the expert in our analytical solutions, including credit risk, ESG and climate risk, you will represent Predictive Analytics’ risk modelling expertise in the region, working with teams across and outside of our OU as well as local sales team.

You will be involved in our research innovations and local client-facing activities that include technical aspects to maintain high level of value perceived in our products. These include planning and developing content for thought leadership, promoting our solutions in local webinars, events, research papers and case studies.

Responsibilities

  • Work with PA Research and Modelling team to design research innovations for a wide range of analytical solutions using innovative traditional and sophisticated machine learning methodologies.
  • Serve as the region’s subject matter expert for PA analytical solutions to develop positive relationship of advocacy and trust with local customers.
  • Deliver presentations for various internal and external audiences and write research papers and articles to demonstrate the value and application of our analytical solutions.
  • Follow modern methods of the intersection of ML, econometrics and statistics, and industry best practices for risk modelling.
  • Partner closely with sales teams on efforts related to client retention and expansion of business opportunities with existing customers.
  • Provide analytical support for product strategy decisions such as product localization efforts and data exploration for regional partnerships.

Qualifications

  • Validated expertise in leading risk model design using Machine Learning and/or econometric modeling techniques working with large datasets from multiple sources and vendors.
  • Advanced programming skills in R, Python and/or SAS.
  • Prior customer facing experience is preferred but not required
  • Proven ability to communicate technical content clearly and concisely to non-technical audiences
  • Strong academic background – A Ph.D., MS or Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Economics, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, Finance, or other relevant field
  • Proven track record to work in a collaborative team environment
  • Self-starter to build required content and with ability to supervise and train co-workers
  • Must be an intrinsically motivated, responsible person who can work well with others, able to operate relatively independently
  • Excellent writing, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
  • The successful candidate will also possess the following qualities:
  • Adaptable
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Effective prioritization and time management

Annual base salary gross: $5.00   Actual salaries will vary and will be based on various factors, such as candidate’s qualifications, skills, and competencies. The salary is one component of Moody’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards and benefits include the following: Medical, Personal Accident, Life Insurance and Time Off.

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

Candidates for Moody's Corporation may be asked to disclose securities holdings pursuant to Moody’s Policy for Securities Trading and the requirements of the position. Employment is contingent upon compliance with the Policy, including remediation of positions in those holdings as necessary.

For more information on the Securities Trading Program, please refer to the STP Quick Reference guide on ComplianceNet

Please note: STP categories are assigned by the hiring teams and are subject to change over the course of an employee’s tenure with Moody’s.

We are seeking Analytics & Modeling Analyst to join our Data Analytics and Solutions team. The team focuses on developing products related to insured property exposures, data, and related applications. Such products are an important part of RMS product line and provide a wealth of valuable information for our clients.

 

The candidate will be working in a multidisciplinary environment developing, designing and implementing a wide range of data products and solutions used in catastrophe risk modeling, valuation modeling and Property & Casualty data quality assessment and enhancement. The candidate will be expected to gain and further utilize an in-depth knowledge of the products and relevant technologies.

 

The incumbent of this role will be primarily responsible for technically leading and working hands-on on modeling project in the team and guiding other members working on these. Including but not limited to:

 

  • Executing model testing and implementation
  • Developing model-derived layers for RMS data products using RiskLink and Risk Modeler
  • Productizing ALM profiles for RiskLink and HD models
  • Developing and executing methodology for data quality scoring and benchmarking of client coded exposure for all modelled regions and perils.
  • Working closely with product managers and core modeling and software teams to develop specifications and prototypes for integrating data quality solutions with RMS platform.

 

Requirements:

 

  • MS degree in an engineering or science related field including but not limited to: Financial Engineering, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Econometrics and Statistics
  • 6 - 8+ years of hands-on experience in similar roles
  • In-depth knowledge of catastrophe models and methodologies preferably acquired in model testing or implementation role.
  • Programming skills in Python or R or similar with demonstrated experience of automation.
  • Proficiency in MS SQL
  • Excellent written and verbal skills, as evidenced by white papers or technical presentations at meetings and conferences.

 

Added Advantage:

 

  • Knowledge of GIS preferred, including experience with ARCGIS or QGIS.
  • Experience in one or more of the following would be useful: data mining, data analytics, developing statistical models.

 

Other Skills:

 

  • Detail-oriented, self-driven quick learner with very strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and a high degree of self-motivation.
  • Ability to independently lead, manage and drive projects.

Install/upgrade or help with the installing and upgrading of software.

IT Savvy with prior full SDLC implementation experience in at least one of the following fields: loan origination, banking, risk management (Basel III capital, credit and liquidity risk), ALM, regulatory reporting, accounting and finance related systems
Strong functional and business skills in Finance (banking and/or Trading book)
Excellent presentation, organizational, verbal and written communication skills

job_description:
Posting Title

Asst Dir-Data Management

Entity

MAIPL

  

City

Bangalore, India

Line of Business

CS

 

Role/Responsibilities

 

 

 

 

 

 

We are seeking an Asst Dir-Data Management to join the EMEA team of our structured finance content production group.

 

The Team is responsible for Deal Discovery, Report Sourcing, Data acquisition, Data enrichment and Data maintenance in our systems and timely updates to our cash flow models of various EMEA securitization deal libraries (ABS, RMBS) using our in-house tools and systems.

 

In this role, your key objectives will be to augment our Deal Discovery operations. This will involve identifying and cataloguing new issuances, guiding team in identifying sources for periodic reports, thereby maintaining a competitive coverage. Simultaneously, you will look after Data acquisition and management, where you'll employ our proprietary system to enhance our data coverage, quality, and timeliness. Collaboration will be essential as you'll work in tandem with data teams, financial engineers, and developers from multiple global locations. Your collective aim will be to amplify the quantity and quality of our content offerings, while also streamlining our business processes.

 

In this role, you'll have the opportunity to directly engage with Trustee, Issuers and Arrangers of Structured Transactions, resolving issues and fostering beneficial relationships. Your understanding of various deal structures and cash flow features of securitization transactions across different asset classes will be crucial. You'll be expected to leverage this knowledge to facilitate cross-training within the team.

 

Moreover, you'll work closely with client support teams and asset class desks, addressing client challenges, contributing to new feature developments, and analyzing new securitization products in the market. Your goal will be to drive innovation and ensure our offerings remain at the forefront of industry developments.

  • Ensure the EMEA ABS and RMBS deal universe is up-to-date for prompt report sourcing, data extraction, conduct data quality assessments, and implement necessary resolutions.
  • Acquire knowledge about our cash flow modelling software to scrutinize projected Cash Flows for a range of EMEA ABS and RMBS transactions for any discrepancy reported by internal as well as external clients.
  • Take part or spearhead projects aimed at boosting quality and productivity.
  • Engage in the development and enhancement of various proprietary tools used for data extraction, cash flow modeling and model updates.
  • Collaborate effectively with client success teams on client hurdles, new feature creations, and fresh securitization product analyses in the market.
  • Regularly evaluate, revise, and optimize existing processes to eliminate redundancy, clear bottlenecks and automate manual tasks, thereby improving response time.
  • Address and rectify any data and cash flow queries from both internal and external clients.
  • Scrutinize, comprehend, and reconcile any inconsistencies between closing legal documents and existing cash flow models.
  • This role demands meticulous attention to detail and the ability to function efficiently in a team environment to deliver accurate results promptly.

 

 

Qualifications

  • Possess a Master's degree in a quantitative field such as Finance, Engineering, Statistics, or Mathematics.
  • Minimum of six years of practical experience in the structured finance sector, specifically dealing with data or cash flow models.
  • Proven experience in projects involving data quality, data cleanup, and data enrichment.
  • Knowledge and understanding of the structured domain, including agency and non-agency RMBS, CMBS, ABS, and CDOs.
  • Proficiency in writing SQL queries, debugging complex SQL stored procedures, and handling read/write access to databases.
  • Practical knowledge of programming languages such as Python, VBA, or C# is mandatory.
  • Exceptional organizational skills with the capacity to manage multiple projects under strict deadlines and maintain attention to detail.
  • Strong quantitative and analytical abilities.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the confidence to interact with business stakeholders at all levels.
  • Ability to quickly adapt and learn in a dynamic environment.
  • Excellent team player with the ability to work effectively with remote and globally dispersed cross-functional teams.
  • Creative problem-solving skills with a propensity for innovation.
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively to implement innovative solutions within the MA organization and across all business units.
  • Proven ability to effectively manage project activities, taking responsibility for outcomes.

Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

 

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

 

The Data Solutions division is the commercial data business of Moody’s Analytics, bringing together a vast catalogue of data to help business decision-makers assess risks and opportunities. We are best known for Orbis, the world’s most comprehensive database of public and private companies. We are also the definitive source of ratings-related data for companies and securities that have been rated by Moody’s Investors Service. We strive to deliver convenience and insight to our customers by eliminating the hassle of sourcing, preparing and accessing data, adding value when decisions need to be made. Any analytical activity depends on reliable and accessible data, and we are proud to be a mission-critical information resource for decision-makers around the world.

The Role / Responsibilities:

Our Software Engineers help drive our customer-intensive business by creating and managing expert software services to process real-time news feeds, many of which have sub-second requirements. You will be part of a highly motivated team responsible for handling millions of digital assets daily. We are looking for a subject matter expert in Node.js development using TypeScript/JavaScript and Hapi framework. High-performance computing and superb programming abilities are expected.

Software Engineer is seen as an expert in several technologies within the software engineering field:

  • Provide expert level advice on multiple technologies across projects.
  • Provide advice on requirements using expert level of knowledge on the possible technology solutions.
  • Author technical design documents for shared modules
  • TypeScript development skills, high-performance computing and superb programming abilities are expected.
  • Take ownership of Business Missions/Epics and stories; Implement and test features based on the requirements.
  • Collaborate across functional and project teams to assist in fixing the most complex/difficult defects.
  • Investigate and find the root cause for the most complex software problems reported by clients. Show expertise when communicating with clients via email and phone regarding these defects.
  • Provide input to continuously improve our engineering practices.
  • Play a primary role in training sessions and knowledge sharing across the teams.
  • You need to ask the right questions, log what needs to be logged, run the right diagnostics, build the correct software employing the proper algorithms, and provide crystal-clear answers to questions about your code.
  • You will need to set high-performance goals for yourself, assume responsibility and accountability, and self-impose standards of excellence in a structured environment with your manager.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum bachelor’s degree in computer science or related majors from accredited institutions, Master is a plus.
  • 2+ years’ professional software development experiences on multi-tiered enterprise applications.
  • Deep understanding of Object-Oriented design and programming.
  • Clear understanding of Software Development Life Cycle: Jira, Git, CI/CD
  • Expertise with AWS cloud environments, Opensearch, Redis and RedPanda Kafka
  • Expert in Programming Languages: Node.js with TypeScript.
  • Familiar with SQL Databases: SQL (MySQL), DynamoDB, MongoDB and other NoSQL engines.
  • Expert in Development Platforms: Linux
  • Comfortable with Development tools: Visual Studio Code, Eclipse (CDT) and others.
  • Experience with API gateways for maintainability and observability a big plus.
  • Expertise in building large-scale, high-volume APIs with RESTful services using micro-service architecture.
  • Quick learner and adapts new technologies; is motivated to learn latest technologies and share this knowledge with others.
  • Able to communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Works well in a fast-paced team environment; able to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines.
  • Has strong analytical and problem-solving skills. 
  • Consistently displays good presentation skills. 
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
  • Expertise on agile process, including SCRUM; mentors others to improve development process more broadly.

Moody’s also offers insurance and a discounted employee stock purchase plan for limited duration employees.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

Responsibilities


Analyze data, contribute regional and macro analysis to company publications, write recurring
and original research articles for company and other research publications, and substantively
contribute to our website commentary by covering economic indicators, writing blogs, and
writing detailed commentary pieces.

  • Assume responsibility for forecasting and analyzing sub-national and country
    economies, acting as an expert for higher-profile economies in the Asia-Pacific region.
  •  Establish subject matter expertise and regularly contribute original research.
  • Assume responsibility for complex individual custom contract consulting projects and
    relationships with minimal supervision.
  • Works independently to create original research reports on forward looking topics for
    publication in monthly products.
  • Assists with monthly forecast processes and takes responsibility for quality checks for
    broader range of components of the forecast.
  • Responsible for equation estimation and model building, working independently but
    with final review by senior staff.
  • May contribute to subscription product editing and participate in training of more junior
    economists.
  • Participate in higher-profile media interviews, as necessary, in areas of expertise and the
    broader economy.
  • Lead teleconferences and regularly present at client conferences individually or jointly
  • Supervises an Associate Economist and/or Economist 1 or 2 including day-to-day
    management and writing and delivery of performance evaluations.
     

Qualifications

  • PhD in Economics or related field and three plus years of experience -OR- Master’s degree
    and seven plus years of experience -OR- Bachelor’s degree and ten plus years of
    experience.
  • Experience in macroeconomic analysis, technical writing, and econometric modeling
    software, and statistical analysis.
  • Must be a motivated, responsible person who can work well with others independently
    of daily supervision
  • Strong interpersonal skills are required in order to work directly with clients to fulfill
    scheduled customized products.
  • Excellent writing and presentation skills.
  • Ability to work independently and to supervise and train co-workers

job_description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

The Strategic Accounts sales team covers a list of Moody's Analytic's (MA’s) largest/most strategic global accounts, and is responsible for growing sales for all MA product offerings available in our product suite. The team is split across regions and works together globally with the common objective to grow revenue across the accounts.

 

 

 

The Role / Responsibilities:

 

The Relationship Manager (“RM”) will be responsible for managing and growing the commercial relationship with a number of Moody’s largest and most strategic global customers in the Americas and Europe & Africa. This includes renewing large existing books of business and growing the revenue through the setting and execution of a sales strategies. The RM covers all of Moody’s Analytics (“MA”) products and solutions except for Content Licensing. The territory is comprised of payments institutions, including some of the largest global names in this segment.

 

The Relationship Manager is a sales executive responsible for the overall commercial success of MA in her/his territory (meeting sales target objectives).  Successful RMs create their own success by displaying some or all of the following:

  • Developing and executing on account commercial strategies & business plans, providing sales forecasts and pipeline information to management
  • Developing and maintaining knowledge of industry trends and practices in payments, risk management (including emerging risks such as credit, climate/ESG, cyber), KYC/financial crime, finance and regulatory compliance
  • Gaining and maintaining familiarity with client organization and processes to help direct them towards the appropriate MA solution(s)
  • Acting as the point of contact for C-Level (e.g. CRO, CFO, COO, CCO, CDO, CTO/CIO) at the client company to help elevate the relationship as a trusted advisor
  • Organizing and running over 200+ in-person client meetings per year as well as representing MA at industry events
  • Generating, qualifying and converting new leads through networking and prospecting and executing sales campaigns at existing accounts, including cross-selling
  • Identifying and translating client-based needs into compelling solutions that create tangible benefits to our clients
  • Demonstrating the superiority and value of MA’s solutions to your customers
  • Managing sales cycles through effective coordination and collaboration with colleagues regionally and globally, the different Operating Units (sales specialists, product management) and Sales management where appropriate. Executing strong negotiation skills and strategies to bring sales cycles to successful closure

 

 

Additional responsibilities include:

  • Providing current sales forecasts and sales pipeline information to management on a regular basis.
  • Introducing sales leads to other business units where appropriate.
  • Making significant and regular travel to and within the territory (when/where possible)

 

 

 

Qualifications:

  • A Moody’s employee at the Director level would typically have 10+ years or more of sales / relationship management experience, normally within the financial services sector
  • Experience working within or selling into financial institutions, payments, and/or fintechs
  • Data or KYC/compliance sales experience preferred but not necessary
  • Solid demonstrated understanding of the banking or payments industries as well as the market players
  • Degree educated (or equivalent), preferably gained in a finance, business or economics
  • Entrepreneurial style, drive and sense of urgency, coupled with the ability to work well with others as part of a solution team. Robust problem-solving and influencing skills
  • Ability to work autonomously with minimal supervision, yet integrate appropriately with sales teams and other areas within MA when necessary
  • Proven sales track record of capability and ability to influence key decision makers during the sales process
  • Ability to sell with a consultative approach, manage complex sales processes
  • Networking skills to identify and develop new business opportunities
  • Creative problem-solving skills and ability to diagnose issues and develop solutions
  • Highly organised and good time management skills
  • Must have the motivation and ability to excel in an intense, high energy, selling environment
  • Fluent English is essential and having additional language capabilities would be advantageous

For US-based roles only: the anticipated hiring base salary range for this position is  [[$115,000]]  to  [[$185,000]] , depending on factors such as experience, education, level, skills, and location. This range is based on a full-time position. In addition to base salary, this role is eligible for incentive compensation. Moody’s also offers a competitive benefits package, including not but limited to medical, dental, vision, parental leave, paid time off, a 401(k) plan with employee and company contribution opportunities, life, disability, and accident insurance, a discounted employee stock purchase plan, and tuition reimbursement.

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, gender, age, religion, national origin, citizen status, marital status, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Moody’s also provides reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities or based on a sincerely held religious belief in accordance with applicable laws. If you need to inquire about a reasonable accommodation, or need assistance with completing the application process, please email accommodations@moodys.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only, and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

For San Francisco positions, qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

This position may be considered a promotional opportunity, pursuant to the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act.

Team/Department Description:
The Senior Communications Strategist will sit within Global Corporate Affairs Team as an integral part of Moody’s Shared Services, the branch of Moody’s responsible for providing professional services to support the success of our global MIS & MA businesses.

Role/Responsibilities:
The Senior Communications Strategist works with the Global Corporate Affairs Team to develop and execute on communication plans and strategies, with a primary focus on engaging with media outlets, journalists, and influencers to effectively communicate key messages and ensure positive media coverage. 

Acting as a business partner to groups within the company and partnering with colleagues across the Global Corporate Affairs team globally, the Senior Communications Strategist contributes to a wide spectrum of initiatives driving either internal or external communications projects that further the team’s mission to be a strategic partner driving Moody’s thought leadership, enhancing reputation and influencing perception through clear and persuasive communications.

With a focus in Media Relations, the Senior Communications Strategist supports the execution of media outreach strategies to help achieve business goals, including creation and editing communications materials and participation in the development and ongoing refinement of communications tactics.

•    Lead business partner to internal business teams
•    Responsible for strategic planning and promoting the line of business or rating group’s thought leadership and/or marketing messages to the media. 
•    Manages potential risk and crisis management strategies. 
•    Build and maintain strong relationships with journalists, editors, and media outlets, specifically in the financial services sector. 
•    Proactively pitch story ideas, press releases, and thought leadership content to relevant media contacts. 
•    Respond to media inquiries promptly and effectively, ensuring accurate and positive coverage. 
   - Monitor media coverage and provide regular reports to internal stakeholders. 
   - Identify opportunities for media interviews, speaking engagements, and other media-related activities.
•    Conducts media training.
•    Develops key message documents, Q&As.
•    Monitoring, analyzing and reporting on resulting coverage. 
•    Manages social medial campaigns.
•    May lead others and provide coaching, guidance and performance management.
•    Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align communication efforts with marketing, public relations, and investor relations activities.

Qualifications:
•    Undergraduate degree in communications or related discipline. Master’s degree is a plus.
•    A minimum of 5 years’ experience in communications, public relations, and/or journalism, ideally within the financial services sector or corporate environment.
•    Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
•    Strong presentation skills.
•    Strong detail orientation and time management skills, including the ability to handle multiple priorities.
•    Ability to advise and influence business partners.
•    Strong positive attitude, with sense of self-motivation and accountability.
•    Adaptable, flexible, and open to change.
•    Strong technical/computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Office, specifically PowerPoint, Excel, Word, and SharePoint Software.
•    English fluency/proficiency is essential; an additional language is helpful.

Qualifications Specific to Media Relations:
•    Minimum of four years of public relations/communications experience, either agency or in-house, ideally within the financial services sector.
•    Experience in managing a range of relationships with both external media and internal clients.  
•    Demonstrated ability to formulate and execute near-term and long-range communications strategies.  

For US-based roles only: the anticipated hiring base salary range for this position is  [[$90,000]]  to  [[$130,500]] , depending on factors such as experience, education, level, skills, and location. Moody’s also offers a competitive benefits package, including not but limited to medical, dental, vision, parental leave, paid time off, a 401(k) plan with employee and company contribution opportunities, life, disability, and accident insurance, a discounted employee stock purchase plan, and tuition reimbursement.

The Role:

As part of the Accounts Payable team, the AP Senior Associate is responsible for ensuring accurate and timely onboarding of new suppliers as well as updating existing suppliers using an exacting framework to mitigate against fraudulent activity. In this role, you will be the first line of defense for Moody’s to ensure our Vendor Master file is current in order for payments to be processed in a timely manner.

Responsibilities:

  • Maintaining compliance and consistency with internal control policies in respect to collecting required documentation and validating suppliers.
  • Ensuring OFAC approval acquired for all new suppliers.
  • Resolving supplier cases in a timely manner with the assistance of AP supervisor as needed.
  • Advising manager on any unresolved or frequent issues that arise that may impact supplier onboarding and/or updates to existing suppliers.
  • Proactively review current process and seek ways to improve the process.
  • Assisting other members of the department in running their workloads and meeting deadlines.
  • Additional duties/projects as assigned by your manager.

Qualifications:

  • 0-2 years Accounts Payable experience
  • Must have excellent organizational and follow-up skills.
  • Must have good communication skills, verbally and written.
  • Good social skills
  • Able to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
  • Computer literate, including knowledge of Microsoft office.
  • Knowledge of Coupa preferred, not vital.
  • Knowledge of SAP Financial systems preferred, not vital.

job_title: Associate - Client Service & Application Support Specialist
job_primary_address: No.8 Xin Yi Rd, 14F, Section 5, Xinyi Dist.
job_description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

Role / Responsibilities 

In this role, you will be a part of the banking and financial application support specialist team that supports our global clients in using Moody’s Analytics solutions to make critical business decisions.

This is an opportunity to develop your career in financial services industry using the world-class software. You will obtain broad knowledge of leading credit risk solutions by working with the latest breed of financial software. You will also ensure that our software solutions, data, financial models, and technology are used effectively and appropriately to add value to our clients’ businesses.

Key Responsibilities:
•    Acquire in-depth knowledge of Moody’s Analytics Loan Origination and Credit Assessment software solutions and the technology, environments, and platforms they run on.
•    Accurately troubleshoot and investigate complex technical issues reported by client through hands-on, and respond to client demands in a courteous, professional, accurate and timely manner. 
•    Take ownership of issues reported to Moody’s, which could be cause by the software bug or the client’s technical environment. Manage and escalate requests appropriately while maintaining ownership of the client interaction and delivery solution.
•    Provide in-depth education and assistance to client on product features, functionality, and the product technical architecture.
•    Communicate effectively and develop excellent working relationships with colleagues within Client Service and in partner teams such as Engineering, Services, CloudOps, Product Management, etc.
•    Identify, capture, and channel client feedback on product to the Product Managers.

Qualifications

•    Must be educated to degree (or equivalent) level in Information System, Computer Science, Engineering, or similar disciplines.
•    Minimum 2-3 years relevant experience in the areas of development, implementation, support, or data analytics of enterprise software. Banking software experience is a plus.
•    Being technically strong, with good analytical skills and the ability to troubleshoot the software error and find solutions via analysis of application logs, SQL queries, program codes and error messages.
•    Good understanding of Postgres or any other relational database (admin and use).
•    Good SQL skills are essential. Experience in C# programming, .NET web application, and/or Windows Server administration are advantageous but not mandatory.
•    Understanding of the Amazon AWS Cloud environment is a plus.
•    Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Be able to explain the complex technical issues to the customers.
•    Ability to work autonomously with minimum supervision in a remote working environment yet engage effectively with the team and other departments within Moody’s.
•    Fluency in Chinese and English language is essential.
 

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

Candidates for Moody's Corporation may be asked to disclose securities holdings pursuant to Moody’s Policy for Securities Trading and the requirements of the position. Employment is contingent upon compliance with the Policy, including remediation of positions in those holdings as necessary.

For more information on the Securities Trading Program, please refer to the STP Quick Reference guide on ComplianceNet

Please note: STP categories are assigned by the hiring teams and are subject to change over the course of an employee’s tenure with Moody’s.
